Opinión: "Interesting small museum. The downstairs is the house that he was born in, complete with turn-of-the century decor and furnishings. Upstairs there are galleries of his mostly early career paintings. Many impressionism, post-impressionism, and cubist works. I found the portraits most compelling."

"Ubicado en la zona turística la casa donde el famoso pintor vivió una etapa de su infancia , cuenta con réplicas de los muebles que en su época estuvieron acomodados en cada habitación, pinturas originales , una de las más destacadas la que realizó a los 11 años que fue la que lo colocó con los grandes maestros en Europa, vale la pena realizar un recorrido con guía."

"La exposición de obras de Diego Rivera es muy buena, que es el atractivo principal del museo... sin embargo las exposiciones temporales de otros artistas en las salas contiguas también son una buena opción…"

Título de la opinión: "A great place to pay homage to the great painter and celebrated son of Guanajuato"
Opinión: "Diego Rivera was born in Guanajuato and his family decided in late 20th century to turn it into a museum. There are not too many paintings of Rivera himself (most are in Mexico City), but there r are always visiting exhibitions by famous Mexican contemporary painters. What you did get is a glimpse of how Rivera family lived in comfortable surroundings in 19th century, and the museum is full of period furniture.The interesting thing is that the museum was almost empty, whilst you cannot enter into his equally celebrated spouse´s (Frida Kahlo) museum in Mexico City without queuing up to four hours.It is not just her fabulous paintings but also the memorable role by Selma Hayek in the movie which made her an even greater icon."

Título de la opinión: "Deeper insight into the artist plus other high quality art on display"
Opinión: "If you are interested in the man and his historical relationship with Mexico and the Communist movement, this is a must see. His early work and description of his upbringing will help you to understand his education and talents. The lower floors are furnished in a manner that was very much the way he lived during his brief stay here. You will need to climb 3 flights of stairs to see it all, but the upper floors have rotating exhibitions of very fine artists and is worth the effort. The museum shows his early work along with many sketches dealing with communist and cubist influences."

Título de la opinión: "Great mixture of historic and contemporary Mexican Art"
Opinión: "With a new section they just added, this museum offers a full spectrum of art from the life and works of iconic Mexican painter Diego Rivera to the works of contemporary Mexican artists. Two of the spaces have rotating exhibitions."

"This museum is walking distance from the city center and it's a real hidden gem, 3 floors full of art of one of Mexico's most important artist. The collection is owned by Diego's grand daughter and I highly recommend visiting, price is really cheap."

"Didn’t know too much about Diego going in, I’ve seen the Frida movie and seen his face on the 500 peso note and that’s all I know. It was a cute little art gallery/museum. It could have had a bit more about Diego himself so people like myself could learn more about the man. It also had parts with art work from other artists but no explanations of who they were in English, but that’s my fault for not knowing Spanish. Anyway mate if you have some time to spare I guess it’s a nice little thing to do but I wouldn’t go out of your way unless you’re a big Diego fan."

Título de la opinión: "Me hice más consciente de Diego Rivera."
Opinión: "Desde el precio accesible de 25 pesos para ver o saber que solamente entre famosos murales del esposo de Rivera, Frida Kahlo. Yo sólo pensé en ver la misma figura cómica de Diego Rivera. El trabajo de Rivera no es mucho incluso había visto fotos de otros artistas. La descripción esta bien en inglés."

"Es un excelente museo con las cosas donde nació Diego Rivera, es una sección del museo, las otras son exposiciones temporales muy bien distribuidas y diseñadas en su museografía. Vale la pena visitarlo cuenta con talleres infantiles y una librería."

Título de la opinión: "We love Diego Rivera so we loved this place"
Opinión: "Small, most of the art is from when he was young, but you get to see the whole house so it gives a sense of middle class life in Guanajuanto. Assuming you share our art tases, a must see."

Título de la opinión: "Some great art by Jose Parra and others"
Opinión: "This is not a museum with Rivera art. It was his boyhood home and that is interesting. But there's a lot of great art on the walls. Also there is a audio/visual guide to one of Riveras famous murals (which is not in the house) that I really enjoyed."

"Entrar a la casa Diego Rivera es transportarse en el tiempo, es imaginar escenas, crear momentos en la mente, ver a Diego en cada rincón, es llenarte de la cultura misma de grandes pintores, cada pasillo te conduce a una nueva sorpresa, cada recamara a un mundo que te hará ver la vida desde otra perspectiva, altamente recomendable para quien gusta del dibujo, la pintura y el muralismo, cuando viajes a Guanajuato desvíate unas cuadras y camina por la calle Positos entre la Universidad y la Alhondiga encontrarás esta bella casa restaurada donde además del costo accesible, veras trabajos de grandes artistas y saldrás con un grato sabor de vista."

Título de la opinión: "Not a must visit site, but a quick stop to learn about Diego!"
Opinión: "We ate lunch at San Angel Inn which is next door, so we decided to stop here afterward. It was a Saturday afternoon, and there was about a 5 minute wait to enter Diego’s home. Admission was 35 pesos per person. We spent about 45 minutes touring the homes of Diego Rivera, Frida Kahlo, and Juan O’Gormon. The complex doesn’t have much of Diego’s famous artwork on display. There are some small figurines and paper mache pieces on display in his studio. When we visited, there was an exhibit about Diego’s involvement in the USSR and included his photos and sketches from his visit with the Soviets. I thought it was interesting history. Note, most information is in Spanish, but there are a few English signs summarizing the history. I wouldn’t go out of my way to visit this place, but if you are in the area, definitely stop by!"
"Llegamos 15 minutos antes de cerrar. Y la chica de la entrada muy grosera, no nos permitió entrar diciendo que ella sale a las 2:30. Pésimo servicio."

"As with most museums in Mexico, the cost of admission is very affordable. So I will not complain that I did not get my money's worth. But I did not get much out of this experience. If I hadn't seen Rivera murals in a number of locations in Mexico City, visited Frida's Casa Azul and seen the movie Frida, I am not sure I would have come out of this museum with an appreciation or understanding of Rivera's work. 
Maybe our mistake was that we did not have a Spanish guide to help us interpret what we were seeing, But, in general, the focus seemed to be more on a historic house than on Rivera's life and work.
By all means if you are walking by, drop in (it will take less than an hour). But there are much better attractions in Guanajuato (actually the city itself is a beautiful work of art) including the Alhondiga de Granaditas. Then, in CDMX, visit the National Palace, Palacio de Bellas Artes and Casa Azul for more RIvera."

Título de la opinión: "Muy interesante la historia y la Expo temporal"
Opinión: "Me sorprendió la historia de esta casa ya que son datos que en lo personal desconocía sobre Diego rivera, hay varios bocetos originales de el. En lo personal lo que más me gusto fue la exposición temporal que tenían de José Parra (pintor de las fotografías)"

"If you’re lucky enough, you’ll get to hear a lot of history from one of the guides. You get to see some obscure work by Rivera and a taste of how the house looked like when he was born. There’s also another exhibit hall with works by other famous painters. Photos are not allowed."
"Otra visita a este lugar y cerrado, por el 19 marzo lunes, por el puente del 21 de marzo. Turistas no importan. Muy mal."
"Not what I expected as there is very little of his art on display here and you cannot take pictures of the better examples. I found it a bit boring, to be honest."

"Hermoso lugar adaptado a la modernidad pero sin dejar atrás su historia y su hermosa casona, el museo tiene 3 apartados, en la planta baja es una sala en la que se presentan obras de diversos artistas, se muestran artículos originales que pertenecieron a la familia del famoso muralista y lo mas importante la presentación de sus obras originales como bocetos y más. Definitivamente tienen que visitarla."
"We went expecting to see a comprehensive selection of Rivera's work. It was primarily sketches and work from his formative years, but not of his nature works for which he is famous."
"I loved the amazing building where he spent the first 6 years of his life. More artwork would've been good but even the house worth a visit."

"The entry fee is very affordable (cheap) so you are taking little risk. It apparently is the place where Diego spent the first 6 years of his life, but you really don't see anything personal about that. There are a few floors of his works - but mostly smaller pieces and none of his murals. If you are pressed for time, I would pass on this. If you have the time - stop in."

"This was my first time here. Interesting art work some of which is his work. Didn’t pay too much attention to the other artists work. Great layout of the house, just wished they gave more information on Diego Rivera’s work."

Título de la opinión: "Excellent replication of early living and art work"
Opinión: "Great Museum and replica pieces of early home of Rivera. Kudos to the family of Diego Rivera to offer this wonderful Museum and pieces of art work. Rivera was the "real deal" for Spanish artists, encompassing several periods of art."
"Están muebles de la época, pinturas del artista. Es un edifico de 3 nivel donde recorres párate de la historia de el."

Título de la opinión: "Somewhat interesting but not high on my list of have to go to it"
Opinión: "I enjoyed my visit but there are several other museums in Guanajuato I would visit first. I found the flow of the museum a bit disconcerting and many of the pieces underwhelming."
"Really enjoyed. Interesting to hear of Diego Rivera's youth. Some art work is not original but a very good exhibit. Very inexpensive. Be prepared to go up 3 flights."

"My friend and I, both artists, loved this quiet house museum just down the road from the university in old Guanajuato. For those that like time travel, you will enjoy getting a feel for the childhood of Mexico’s most successful early 20th century artist/firebrand. This is not a spot for famous paintings, but very nice drawings including some from student days."
"Great museum and gallery. Definitely a must see!! We spent a couple of hours and having English signage added to our experience!"

"On a busy Saturday, this was a bit of a haven from the crowded streets. A bit off the beaten track, for MXP25, one gets to visit the birthplace of Diego Rivera. It is an interested home but the highlight is early works by Rivera, David Siqueiros, and Orozco - - 3 of Mexico's most renowned muralists."

"This was one of the first places I visited during my trip to Guanajuato. It was one of the best experiences I had. I loved how they represent and show the furniture in each room. This was the house where the famous painter was born. The whole three story house is very well mantained. You can not miss a visit to this attraction when you travel to Guanajuato. Fee for entrance US$3.00."

Título de la opinión: "Visita obligada al museo de Diego Rivera"
Opinión: "Es la casa donde nació Diego Rivera, con algunas obras auténticas, bocetos y dibujos de Diego, de Siqueiros y algunas otras obras de otros artistas de la época."

"We liked this museum although a little disappointed there wasn’t more of Rivera’s artwork. The house was awesome and must have been incredible in its day. A life sized copy of one of Diego’s famous murals was displayed & had a key below it with explanations about the people dipicted, which was great. Overall, interesting."

"Very nice building, where Diego Rivera was born. 3 or 4 floors with exhibitions and on the top you can listen an audio from a famous picture. My kids were bored and the museum missed an opportunity to offer better explanation from the good exhibition they offer."
"There is an elevator in a remodeled old building. Not a large museum but interesting and worth a visit. Maybe an hour should do it."
"La casa donde se crio el guanajuatense mas famoso, Diego Rivera, bien mantenida con exposicion permamente de autores de la zona. Parada obligada."

Título de la opinión: "You won't see his work that much"
Opinión: "It costs 25 pesos. So which is cheap. For that cost I think this is acceptable even though there is not so many his works."

"Was disappointed in that there was very little of Rivera's artwork and no examples of his murals here. It was more a historical review of his life and a recreation of his childhood home. Interesting but not a "must see"!"

"Very well maintained, clean, well directed, at first it can be confusing which way to go, but you'll find your way around, please read the history notes to find the meaning of each room. Downsides are that only the first floor is historical recreations, the remaining floors are more educational briefings and art galleries. Should have more copies of Diego's work and pictures of his early work, most documented frames are from childhood and old age, barely anything from his real moments in history as a controversial painter with Frida."

"First this is a recreation of the home that Diego Rivera lived in when he was a child.There is a courtyard and a new building. The first floor contains paintings by Diego when he was a young child. These are very realistic and are traditional subjects. While well executed there is no glimpse of the future muralists. The majority of the art is not that of Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo never visited this childhood city. If you have a morning it is interesting to see the first floor paintings but I think this are really for fans of his work or art history majors. The entire museum takes about an hour to go through."

Título de la opinión: "Muy completo y con diversidad en sus exposiciones"
Opinión: "Disfrutamos mucho recorrer este museo y nos gustó mucho su contenido y exposiciones. Muy completo, variado e interesante. Además, el inmueble es en si algo para visitar."

"I enjoyed my visit and Diego Rivera’s life story is compelling. However, I was disappointed by the limited amount of art by Diego Rivera that the museum held- which is what I went there to see!! There was more art by other artists."
"Es muy bonita la casa y se exponen algunas obras muy buenas, que te invitan a conocer más en profundidad al artista."

"One of the "must do" activities in town , partly because there really isn't much else available. don't expect to see very much of Rivera's art--there isn't any. But the house is interesting by itself."
"Tanto por como ordenan las exposiciones, así como la manera en que tienen ambientada la casa para mí es el museo que no te puedes perder en Guanajuato."

"Debes ir cómodo, el museo costa de 3 pisos en el primero apreciarás muebles que Te transportarán a la época de Diego Rivera, también encontrarás en un balcón adentro a Frida y Diego con quienes podrás tomarte fotos, en el segundo piso cuadros de Diego Rivera y sus contemporáneos, en el tercer piso exposiciones de artistas modernos. Sólo cobran el acceso a adultos. Fue la casa de Diego Rivera y su hija fue quien lo convirtió en museo."

"El recinto no solo contenía obra plástica de Diego Rivera, tenía dos exposiciones extras y algo que agradecí es que tenían una Expo de un artista plástico actual "Ramlo" Muy buen trabajo al amueblar con materiales que te transportan a la infancia de uno de los grandes muralistas de México. Buen precio con credencial de estudiante."
"Un buen museo al que vale la pena asistir, ademas de la sobras de Diego Rivera, tambien las exhibiciones de otros artistas tanto actuales como no tan actuales :)"
"Was a very nice experience being able to wander around the former home at your own pace. Lots of art work and a nice glimpse of history."

"Vine a pasar un par de días a Guanajuato y vi la casa donde nació el pintor Diego Rivera, que ahora es museo. Es una hermosa y grande casa color rojo quemado, que está a solo una cuadra de la catedral de Guanajuato y a dos cuadras del Teatro, por lo que puede uno ir a pie, si se encuentra en el centro histórico de la Ciudad. A unas tres cuadras más abajo, se encuentra la Alhóndiga de Granaditas. La calle donde está ubicada, es muy angosta y también las banquetas. Lo mejor es dejar el auto en el estacionamiento Alonso y caminar."
"Desafortunadamente a pesar de ser la casa real de Diego Rivera de cuando era niño, había más obras de Artistas invitados que de Diego Rivera, per aún así es una visita recomendada y disfrutable."

"As everyone should know, Diego Rivera was married to Frida Kahlo. An incredible house that was turned into a museum that gives insight into not only Diego, but that of Frida as well. I didn’t know much about Diego and Frida, prior to the visit, but afterwards, I was refreshingly informed. Of course, navigating through the narrow, winding streets of Guanajuato was of great joy."

"El lugar de nacimiento de Diego Rivera es ahora un museo dedicado al artista mismo. Rivera y su hermano gemelo nacieron en esta casa en 1886 y vivió allí hasta que la familia se trasladó a la Ciudad de México seis años más tarde. Retratos, pinturas y dibujos del pintor."

Título de la opinión: "Loved all of the rooms and exhibits"
Opinión: "I looked at other reviews and folks said they did not like the small rooms. I really liked them and it was a great way to capture exhibits. The rotating exhibits were excellent, and the Rivera pieces were great too. I thought the new atrium addition in the middle was very thoughtfully done and reminded us of The Getty. Definitely worth a visit and was a very nice walk and not too long from Teatro Principal."

Título de la opinión: "Reality check - this place is OK; I think patrons are in love with anything Diego Rivera related"
Opinión: "This house converted into a museum is a historical jewel to highlight Diego's birthplace and beginning. Unfortunately, the building layout is very choppy and doesn't flow well. There is also a modern white atrium in the middle, which is out of touch with the rest of the property. There is also space for temporary art exhibits. I think what would be more appropriate is dedicating space for patrons to understand where in Mexico and the world they can see other Diego Rivera artworks."

Título de la opinión: "I enjoyed this, but beware confusing layout"
Opinión: "I eventually found my way around, but this for me was a good museum with good exhibits. The layout definitely took me a while to get down, but maybe I was having an off day. Enjoy it for an hour or two."

"I love house museum so I enjoyed walking around the Diego Rivera House/Museum. There were paintings by other artists, but I love to see the homes of artists, and see where their inspiration comes from. They had a couple of bedrooms, kitchen and dining room, and it is all compressed into a space going up four levels. And the price $ under 5, so worth it."

"There are rooms set up to feel like the time when Rivera lived here. Separate rooms are set up with a variety of pieces of Rivera’s work and those of his counterparts. Limited signage in English. An art knowledgeable English speaking guide would really help get the most of visit. It did make me curious to find out more about this era and it’s art."

"If you have time to spare and are in the city, I would definitely recommend checking this place out. It's a combined art museum with some rooms on exhibition. According to the guide, most none of the furniture is original. We enjoyed our visit."

"Lugar de nacimiento del famoso Diego Rivera como muralista mexicano. Hay varias habitaciones que están dispuestos los muebles para sugerir el tiempo de la vida a la vez. Inicio de la segunda planta se ha convertido en el espacio para exponer su obra. El arte amantes se recomienda museo."

"It was fun to tour through the four story house that Diego Rivera spent his first six years. It has a central staircase and you can see some of the rooms made up with the furniture of the day. The art was interesting and varied although only a few were his paintings - which I enjoyed."
"Aunque se pueden observar pocas obras del pintor, es un punto importante para conocer un poco más de la vida de este personaje. Precio accesible."

"Es la casa donde nació Diego Rivera, esta llena de obras de arte de el y muchos otros, te cuentan su historia, los guías son muy buenos y explican detalladamente cada pintura. También hay muchos muebles de esa época y puedes admirar como se vivía en esos años, es un lugar muy bonito y esta muy cerca del centro, 5 minutos caminando del centro, ademas es muy económico y gratis si eres estudiante o adulto mayor, tienes que visitar el lugar."
"Glad we stopped here. It's simple but I appreciated the historic interpretations. It's adjoined to a museum of contemporary mexican art, which was worthwhile."

Título de la opinión: "Very Good Only if You Have a Guide"
Opinión: "Two of us went with a guide and learned a lot from his explanations. There is a lack of printed info (in English or Spanish) about any of the artifacts or pieces of art. The biggest attraction was the mural in the auditorium. Without our guide, we would have missed 98% of the meaning of the figures in the painting. A glass addition to the building (which included an elevator) was added about three years ago."

"La casa de Diego Rivera es muy buen museo con muy buenas obras de este personaje así como obras de invitados que se encuentran en la casa. 
Si eres amante de la arte no dudes en visitar la casa de Diego Rivera tiene muy buena exposición."
"Me encanto la arquitectura y estado de conservación del museo. Las obras de arte en exhibición son unicas. ¡¡Excelente visita!!"

"It's a small museum that was once Diego Rivera's home. He was born here and moved to Mexico City when he was 6. His early works are on display as well as other artists. There are like 3 floors (small) and only stairs. It has been very well maintained."

"Es una maravilla pasar por la historia y conocer un poco más de la vidad de uno de los mexicanos mas enigmaticos e importantes, es un deleit disfrutar las pinturas del artista y mucho más la platica del final, es triste que no cuenten con sus mejores obras, pero aun asi es una bella experiencia."
"Love the Rivera art but REALLY like the art of another painter featured in the exhibit! Art is truly a matter of personal taste."
"I enjoyed touring the home, with its rooms and furnishings and the artwork. I did not realize that I like his artwork more than I thought that I would! It is a nice break from other sights."
"Tenía una expectativa más alta del lugar, pero lamentablemente tiene muy pocas obras del artista. Tiene obras de otras personas."
"Se puede observar que cuidan muy bien el lugar, te dan tu espacio para que puedas recorrer de manera confiable el museo."

"De hecho, es muy literaria, pero no es sólo pinturas de Rivera, hay otros pintores, hay muchas exposiciones temporales. Tanto la Cámara y el museo. familia Rivera sigue siendo muy bueno, ja, ja, ja. Pintura ... no entiendo, pero América Latina sigue siendo la misma cepa de la soledad puede sentir claramente. Rivera y Frida mexicana acoplar dos pintor tesoro nacional, también es reconocido mundialmente gran artista. Ellos no se ven a todavía un poco de pérdida de atracciones relacionadas de México."
"Es el hogar del famoso pintor Diego Rrivera pintor de la Revolución Mexicana y su esposa Frida Khalo, la casa está amueblada pero hay muy pocas obras."

"The museum is a very interesting place to visit and presents quite well life 100 years ago. However, the best art of Diego Rivera isn't here. You may find other revolving expos here as well. Don't make it first on your list."
"Esperábamos más, costosa la entrada para lo que ofrecen. Visita guiada corta y demasiado concisa. Poco para recorrer en el centro de la ciudad."
"We enjoyed the building but the art was limited to other artists with little art from Diego Rivera. A quick detour and fun enough but just OK."
"Nos llevamos una grata sorpresa con la visita de la Casa Diego Rivera. Lo mejor es el mural en el auditorio, no lleva más de una hora visitarlo."

"If you're interested in Diego Rivera, you'll want to visit the home where he lived as a young boy. Diego Rivera, who became world famous, was a native son of Guanajuato, and it's interesting to see where he started, as a young boy."

"This is a small museum. Diego Rivera's parents house was renovated and it's quite a contrast between the old house and the new one. I didn't see many artifacts that belonged to Rivera, or paintings. That would have been interesting. I liked the architecture of the house."

Título de la opinión: "A quick trip with kids was enough"
Opinión: "I went in with a 6 and 9 year old and quickly went around the tiny house. It's currently undergoing construction and the electricity was cut for most of our quick visit. It has interesting artwork from artists other than Diego and a nice kid library area. The place was crowded at 10:30 on a Thursday in August and it was hard to walk around the tiny house. It's not expensive to enter and satisfied my tiny curiosity. Diego Rivera painted murals in person in Mexico City that are incredible and worth a visit. This museum is not worth a trip to Guanajuato but is something to do once there."
"Una casa en la que vivió hasta los seis años, ahora exhibe fotografias de parte de su vida. Si tienen tiempo visitenla."

"The Museum has amazing guides that are well knowledgeable of Diego Rivera life. As you go through the Museum it is as if you are traveling through the a time line of Diego Rivera life and painting periods. Kid friendly and you are also exposed to uprising, upcoming, new artists."
"Un lugar lleno de artículos y curiosidades. Perfecto para todo seguidor de Diego. Una casita tradicional y con un encanto muy típico mexicano."
"Aunque no hay grandes obras de Rivera es muy interesante conocer la casa donde nació. Está muy bien montada la exposición y se recorre en poco tiempo."

Título de la opinión: "A house and a small collection of art"
Opinión: "The museum is spread over several floors in an old building near the center of Guanajuato. The lowest level features the childhood home of Diego Rivera. It is an interesting look into the living conditions for fairly well-off people of that era in Mexico. My kids got a kick out of discovering the 'bathroom' of the time. The art collection is rather small, but provided an interesting look at the Cubist works of Diego Rivera. The highlight is the mural on the upper floor of "Dream of a Sunday Afternoon in Alameda Park" There is a key to the mural that identifies all of the people portrayed on the top-most level."
"Deberían fomentar más este tipo de museos, muy bonita la casa y exposiciones súper interesantes de arte contemporáneo."

"We went to Museo Casa Diego Rivera with an expectation of seeing Diego Rivera earliest artwork. When we arrived at the museum, was not as expected! The house of Diego Rivera is more a temporary exhibition due to he only spends six months of his life in this house. The family moved to DF when Diego Rivera had months of born."

Título de la opinión: "Pretty Simple, Worth the 25 Pesos and 45 minutes of you time"
Opinión:
"I stumbled on this as I was leaving my AirBnB one day. For 25 pesos, I spent 45 minutes walking around the house of Diego Rivera. First floor is just room setups, second floor is his early work along with David A Siquieres work. Third floor is just a big mural and small theatre area. 

Diego Riviera's work seems to be across the board, referring to style and texture. The biggest thing I learned is that the top 3 muralist in Mexico are Riviera, Siquieres, and Orozco. We saw Orozco's amazing works in Guadalajara, and we live on David A Siquieres Road in Monterrey Mexico, which I didn't know was a prominent muralist before this visit."

"I enjoyed the old furniture in each room from the living room, the different bedrooms, the library, the old bathroom the childrens room, and so on. Pictures are only NOT allowed in the rooms that have his paintings. I asked the museum employee why, and he replied that Diego Rivera still had one child that was still alive and she still has rights to them! I came to Guanajuato to learn the culture of this region that makes it unique..there were some works from other painters here. I liked the large puppets of Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo that were in the patio of this old house."

"This spot is an excellent place to begin your education on the artist. He lived her for the first six years of his life. Several of his paintings are on the second floor. There's an elevator over in the corner in case you can't walk up all the steps. It's truly a tranquil place for a 20 minute visit. Art students will probably want to stay longer!"

"Visitar la casa donde crecio Diego Rivera es maravilloso, el dia de mi visita nos tocaron dos actores quienes representaron a Diego y a Frida, entre ellos se platicaban y recordaban como Diego vivio, compartio y disfruto en esta maravillosa casona junto a su familia, era como abrir el album de fotos y recordar anecdotas de cada rincon, el moviliario es original, y pasar por esos pasillos donde jugo o corrio Diego es regresar a una época maravillosa de nuestro México querido."
"Es una casa hermosa en donde encuentras cultura de arriba abajo de derecha a izquierda, es un viaje."
"La exposición del trabajo de Diego Rivera es maravillosa e interesante, de igual forma las exposiciones temporales, bastante impactantes."
"Small but interesting collection of art. seeing the birth home of Rivera didn't stir me much but the building and the art contained within are worth going."

"Wasn't expecting much based on the reviews. Most of the art in the museum is from modern day artists and photographers. In the areas with the few Diego pieces, no photos are allowed and there are people in each room to let you know that. The entrance fee is tiny so it won't bankrupt you to take a look but don't get your hopes up. If anything there is a fun bar across the street."
"Pequeño museo en el centro de la ciudad que se encuentra en la casa donde nació Diego Rivera, El museo tiene un muy pobre colección del artista. la entrada cuesta $25 que te puedes ahorrar."
"Es un sitio muy lindo en mi opinión personal. Me tocaron exposiciones que me gustaron. Hace parte de los buenos museos de Guanajuato."

"The first floor is basically a replica of the home Diego grew up in. The upper floor is dedicated mainly to his developing talent. I expected to see some of his great artwork but only one fresco was on display. Very dissappointing."

"Y usted está viajando en México hay una gran cantidad de oportunidades para ver los murales de Diego Rivera. Aquí está la famosa cuna mural del pintor Diego Rivera de dicha México. Fotos de Rivera tomadas en esta casa también se está adornada. También tomamos una imagen en el mismo lugar."
"He only lived here for first 8 years of his life. Not much in the way of his actual work. Small, choppy rooms."

Título de la opinión: "Paltry collection of works by Diego Rivera"
Opinión: "The home mostly features other Artists work. The space has been so remodeled that there is not much of the original home left. Such a disappointment, I expected something comparable to Frida Kahlo museum in Mexico City, this was not the case."
"Este museo es imperdible debido a la gran historia y obras que se encuentran dentro de la casa, es una visita rápida pero sorprendente. Muy recomendable."

Título de la opinión: "Must see - A Family Home of The Most Famous Mexican Artist"
Opinión:
"I didn't know what to expect, but I was very excited that I could climb stairs and walk on the floors this most famous Mexican painter left his marks on. A physical touch converted to a very spiritual experience. 
There is no much of his work there - true, but it is not an Art Gallery, but a home he was born and brought up. We had a very good tour guide (a trip was booked from San Miguel de Allende with BajioGo) and he told us lots of details about Diego Rivera's family and his life, about life after he left his home, and about his work. The entrance fees were included in the whole trip, so I am not sure how much it was. For me, who is an absolute admirer of Diego Rivera’s art it was “must to see” while in Mexico, Guanajuato. Our bags were not checked, except that we had to enter without any drinks. We were told where we could take photos (the main entrance) so I took few picks. Only disappointment was that there were no reproductions of his work for sale (what usually one would expect), so I was hoping I will get something, as I love his art. Definitely it was worth to visit."
"La casa natal del pintor, se pueden encontrar obras suyas de diferentes etapas creativas. Tiene, además, excelentes exposiciones temporales de artistas contemporáneos."

"Fuimos a este museo donde se exponen algunas obras del artista, como en su casa en su totalidad, ya que las obras expuestas. Hay que ver cuando se encuentra en Guanajuato. Recomendado para los amantes del arte."
"El lugar está bien cuidado pero con poquísima obra de Diego Rivera; es más bien un lugar anecdótico para entretenerse 15 minutos."

"This museum does not have much of Diego Rivera's work. There are some sketches and reproductions. After seeing his work/original murals in Mexico city, this was a letdown. Also a big part of the art on display are not his but of other modern artists."

"Este es un museo de menor importancia. De todos modos, no presenta mucho el trabajo del muralista maestro (está en México tienen que ir a ver lo que hizo). La arquitectura de la casa (o decir las reparaciones que datan de 1970), merece una visita. Por el precio, tienes que ir! (25 pesos!). Esta pequeña institución también tiene algunas exposiciones en algunas áreas hermosas."

Título de la opinión: "Bonito, si no es tu primera visita"
Opinión: "Se trata de la casa de los padres de Diego, cuando la visitamos había pocas de sus obras, en su mayoría bocetos. Se usa como sala de exposiciones de otros artistas."

"Can't take drinks in so hide them in your bag or leave at the ticket desk. Some interesting artists exibiting their work. Lovely to see the house part. You can take pictures of the modern art but not of Diego's. Worth a look for 25 pesos."

"También es ir con tiempo, ya que debido a su demanda; te puedes topar con una fila de 30 min o 1 hora... es la casa donde vivió sus primeros 6 años de vida Diego Rivera... tiene detalles hermosos y sus obras son padrísimas."

"This was my second visit to the museum, the first was in 1999. Naturally, there were many changes. The entrance is modernized and there are areas with exhibits of new artists. Diego's early works and sketches are very well kept, and more interesting than the old furniture of the house. Don't forget to go to the top floor and see a replica of a mural with descriptions of the featured characters."
"Conoce la casa en la que fué concebido y nació Diego Rivera. Admira una muestra de sus primeras obras, dibujos y bosquejos."

"Such places as the birth home of .... usually are nothing more than an interesting walk through but this museum is the exception since its collection of Rivera 's works makes it a required destination for those who know of him."

"A solid look at the house that Diego Rivera grew up in except the furniture is not the original stuff, it is period furniture donated to the museum. The art spans the great Diego's life and is just wonderful."

"Este museo está establecido donde fuera la casa de Diego Rivera durante sus primeros 6 años. El lugar cuenta con una pequeña colección. La entrada cuesta 25 pesos. Para estudiantes y personas mayores 10 pesos. Vale la pena la visita pero no es nada que no debas dejar de ver."

"Centrally located museum with wonderful pieces of work for Diego Rivera. Only downside was I travelled with very small backpack that I used as purse and shopping bag They refused to let me take it in and had to check it. I didn't want to check my wallet and valuables so one person in party ended up sitting out for this museum visit. Should be more tourist friendly."

Título de la opinión: "An interesting look into an artist's youth"
Opinión: "This is the boyhood home of Rivera and his former house has actually been absorbed into a museum of his life. The museum is spread across two buildings with multiple floors. The ground floor tries to portray what his house and furnishings might have looked like, but people seem to pass through that quickly to get to the salons where some of his boyhood and later works are displayed. There are also places for temporary exhibits and a good sized auditorium on the top floor. One irritant, however. You are not allowed to take photos in the museum, but then then don't sell a guide to keep for your memories. They should do one or the other."

Título de la opinión: "Worth visiting the old house even if there is little of this work"
Opinión: "Centrally located this is the house where the painter spent his first years. It is a nice house of three floors which houses a museum. The house is nice and interesting to appreciate how the affluent people lived one hundred years ago. There is no much of his work except some sketches, preliminary work and a few reproductions of work in Mexico City."

"This wonderful museum is located in the home where Diego Rivera lived until he was six years old. One of his children had the foresight to work with the government and others to repair and preserve the home and turn it into the present museum. Take the time to wander through the entire four floors - it is worth the effort."
"We weren't that familiar with the work of Diego Rivera but learned a lot from this exhibit, even though most of his own work there are sketches and unfinished works. Beautiful home also."
"A beautifully restored early home of The Rivera family. Many drawings, painting, prints, sketches and sculptures. Well worth visiting."
"House itself unremarkable but Rivera's collection of works (including sketches and studies) by other artists (Atl, Siqueiros, Orozco) very interesting."

Título de la opinión: "En el se encuentra un pedazo de la vida de Diego Rivera"
Opinión: "En los pisos inferiores se preserva el hogar original de los padres del artista, y los pisos superiores son exposiciones de arte y un auditorio. Útil para entrar en el personaje."

Título de la opinión: "Los amantes de la pintura lo van a adorar"
Opinión: "Este lugar, que sirvió de hogar al artista mexicano Diego Rivera, recopila una colección de algunos de los trabajos de este pintor, desde sus inicios, hasta algunas obras interesantes. Recomendado ampliamente para los turistas fanáticos del arte."
"Me esperaba más. Es la casa donde Diego Rivera nació. Se conservan con la decoración original. El tipo de visita es estar en plan de estudios."

Título de la opinión: "Enjoyable but we enjoyed other museums more"
Opinión: "We enjoyed our visit to the Diego Rivera Museum but found other museums to be more inspiring in their displays."

Título de la opinión: "Para saber de la infancia del afamado muralista"
Opinión: "Se trata de la casa paterna de Diego Rivera, adaptada como museo. Da una idea de la vida de Diego en la infancia. En realidad hay más elementos de arte de otros artistas que del mismo Diego."

"Located near the University of Guanajuato, the museum chronicles much of Diego Rivera's life and development as an artist. Many interesting drawings that demonstrate various stages in Diego's artistic formation. Also on display are rooms of the original house where he was born and lived as a child. No great murals or large paintings but well worth seeing."
"La casa esta muy bonita, muy grande, tiene muchas cosas originales y personales del artista, muchas de sus obras son originales, sin duda debes visitarlo."

Título de la opinión: "Un lugar con obras artísticas, no solamente de Diego Rivera, que se disfrutan enormemente"
Opinión: "Este museo no sólo contiene pinturas u objetos de Diego Rivera, también incluye otras colecciones u obras de diferentes artistas que fueron seleccionadas sensiblemente para el gusto de diferentes personas. Lo único que no me pareció correcto es que no permiten sacar fotografías y no puede uno llevarse una memoria tan vívida de este recorrido que es realmente enriquecedor."

"El museo Casa Diego Rivera es mucho grande de lo que aparenta por fuera, y tiene dos diferentes secciones: una dedicada a la vida de Diego Rivera y otra dedicada a su obra. Aunque pudiera parecer aburrido es muy interesante la manera en la que se presentan las obras, pues logra mantenerte interesado por las distintas categorías en las que las agrupa. Un buen lugar para visitar en la ciudad."

"Once paid entrance fee you see small stating that collection of Rivera art is elsewhere. Indeed only few pencil sketches remain . What to see: period furnishings , works of other artists and uptop a copy of Rivera mural. Not worth time or money."

"He was born there so if you are interested in is work, you need to go and visit where he was brought up. It gives interesting information on the different stages of his apprentiship both in Mexico and in Europe. He is one of the great painters of this country so don't miss him."
"We were overwhelmed by the breadth of the contemporary art presented. All of this collection housed in the home Rivera. This visit was the highlight of our visit to Guanajuato."

"Un lugar que te traslada a la época de un grande!, la atención no puede ser mejor... Precios accesibles, un lugar lleno de arte la explicación de guía sobre el mural de Diego Rivera excelente ...nos ayuda a comprender al autor...recomendado y un lugar para volver..."

"Lo interesante de este lugar es que entras a conocer la casa donde nació el famoso pintor Diego Rivera y vivió parte de su niñez, lo mas bonito es el auditorio donde cuentan con pinturas de el. lo que más me gusto es la parte de la casa y el auditorio, las salas de exposición no mucho hay uchas exposiciones de otros pintores, y a mi no me atrae mucho este arte, pero buen lugar para entrar ya estando allá."

"Es un museo dedicado a la obra de Diego Rivera aunque no soy gran fan de el es buen lugar para conocer y conocer más de su vida e influencias artísticas es lugar tiene 3 pisos donde la mayoría es obra de Diego Rivera también cuenta con artistas invitados vale $25 pesos la entrada y cierra a las 6.30, nosotros los vimos todo en una hora. Si se los recomiendo les va a gustar."
"Está bien para ver obras y bosquejos, pero falta explicación y guías. La casa está bien remodelada pero falta contar un poco de su historia."

Título de la opinión: "Really a must see for Diego Fans"
Opinión: "Not your usual museum or usual collection of Diego art work. This is the home where he was born and lived his first six years. And it has been beautifully restored. It has three levels. First level is the home and furnishings and family photos. Second level his Diego's early works (Yes, his Momma seems to have saved his little drawings) Many of them are more than a little faded. But the most interesting thing is on the third floor, where the works of his teachers and mentors are displayed so you can see how they influenced his art. And the guard is a walking DR wikipedia. We talked for so long, the gift shop closed. Speaking of which, I went back to the gift shop the next day and it was a disappointment. I expected well known DR postcards, etc. No, mostly tour books about Gto."
"Gran museo. Su contenido permanente es muy bueno y las propuestas variables suelen ser muy buenas. Un gran lugar."

Título de la opinión: "Bien, pero debería ser gratis o cobrar menos"
Opinión: "La atracción principal es que es la casa donde nació Diego Rivera, y vivió hasta los 6 años, me pareció caro el acceso, para ver una obra muy pequeña de el, lo mas interesante fue las fotografías del auditorio."
"Vale la pena visitar éste museo. La casa de Diego Rivera bien ambientada. La muestra de obras es pequeña pero dá idea de su arte. Vayan."
"With many sites in the surrounding area it is worth your time to check out this beautiful museum and extensive display of works by one of Mexico's great artists."

Título de la opinión: "Pequeño, bien remodelado, pero no cuenta con tanta exhibicion de Diego Rivera"
Opinión: "Esta ubicado en pleno centro, el lugar en si es pequeño, pero lo remodelaron bien, en si tiene poca obra de Diego Rivera exhibiendo, y te hacen alusion de como fue su casa, pero los muebles no son los originales, ¡es bueno solamente!"

"We loved this museum, and it is well worth the time. It is very well curated and includes a nice combination of Rivera's work, his childhood home and its furnishings, the works of other respectable Mexican artists, and a gift/book shop."

"We enjoyed seeing the home of Diego when he was a child. He was one of the great artists of the 20th century and they have many of the artists paintings and drawings, along with work by artists of today."
"El lugar está muy bien remodelado, y las obras de Diego Rivera aunque no son muchas sí vale la pena ir para conocerlas."

"From the outside the building don't look such big than you will find it inside. If you enter you will see original furniture out of the time when he was a child. In the second floor and the upper floors you will find different paintings and drawings by Diego Rivera, but also there are another artist work displayed. Follow strictly the arrows if not you could miss some interesting exhibits."

Título de la opinión: "Certainly Worth a visit to see the Childhood Home of Such an Iconic Artist"
Opinión: "This museum is well-arranged and you will have a pleasant visit as long as your expectations are in check. There are very few actual Diego Rivera works in the museum, but it is charming to tour his boyhood home and to see the works of some other accomplished artists. The mosaic celebrating him and Frida on the upper interior patio was perhaps our favorite item."

"It was nice to see where Diego Rivera grew up, but there were not many paintings by Diego Rivera.... were more drawings. There was another artists work displayed that I loved. It was worth a visit and only 50 pesos for both of us I think."

"Este museo de tres pisos se vende como sede de muchas obras de Diego Rivera, sin embargo, después de recorrer todo el museo, y ante la frustración de no encontrar más que dibujos y bocetos, decidí preguntarle a uno de los guardas, aquí me aclaró que las obras de dos pisos completos se encuentran en restauración, y en otra exhibición en Japón. No dejando así al público ni una sola hora de pintura para apreciar."

"Para mí le hace falta mucho de la obra De Diego Rivera. No hay ninguna obra de el y los muebles no son originales. Solamente una cama de bebe y una cama de adulto de latón son originales de su casa. Los demás muebles son de la época únicamente. Queda mucho por mostrar del artista."

"Very interesting to see where Diego Rivera was born and lived for a time. Much bigger house than you would expect from the outside. Plenty of artwork by him and others. Well worth the effort to find it."

"Si eres un admirador de la obre de Diego Rivera, o del arte en general, tienes que visitar este lugar, hace un recorrido por las distintas etapas de la obra de Rivera, además de colecciones de otros artistas contemporáneos."

Título de la opinión: "Unclear flow through the building...missed a third"
Opinión: "We wound up exiting without seeing a 1/3 of the building (and important part of his work) in the museum. A portion of the museum is his childhood home restored, a portion the sketches from his work, and a portion devoted to other contemporary artists. Go if you have extra time but be clear how to cross to see the full museum. Otherwise, it is not worth the money."

Título de la opinión: "El lugar de nacimiento de Diego Rivera!"
Opinión: "Varias obras en el lugar de nacimiento de Diego Rivera que están en exhibición. Así como la obra de Diego Rivera exposición también obras de otros artistas contemporáneos allí para alfombra personalmente en la Ciudad de México Frida parece atracciones están a menos de un museo."
"Muy buena recreación de época y propuesta artística en exposición Vale la pena la visita Es un lugar pequeño pero bien vale la pena incluirlo en la agenda."

"Aunque la finca ha sido modificada, conserva partes inalterables, muebles, fotografías y algunas obras del extraordinario pintor y muralista, también ofrece otras colecciones temporales de otros artistas."

"Not only is this an art musuem, it is also where Diego Rivera was born. On the first floor, there are rooms with furniture from the period of his birth and upbringing. Very interesting. Many of Diego Rivera´s most famous paintings are in other places, but his artwork that is on display is extremely fascinating. Other exhibits by other painters are also worth seeing. Well laid out."

"Having been to Mexico City last year where there are incredible pieces of his work, it was a bit of a let down to only find early works here, mainly sketches and other minor pieces. However, the temporary exhibit was an added delight. The home is a reconstruction of the one he grew up in, but left when still a small child. It is a bit of a misnomer that this was his home, but his parents."
"Si quieres conocer de cerca a Diego Rivera, seguramente es un buen lugar. Conservaron los muebles de la casa. No es tan interesante."

"Diego Rivera is perhaps most famous for his immense, bold murals. Alas there was a representation of these in one room, with a good guide to the persons included in the painting. Otherwise there were many studies and sketches by Rivera. We really enjoyed an exhibit by a thoroughly talented painter."
"El museo es interesante porque muestra donde nació el pintor Diego Rivera y pasó su infancia, y expone muchas de sus obras. La organización de los museos es débil, pero sigue siendo un buen paseo."
"The birth place of Diego Rivera. How could you skip it? First class museum with excellent collection and temporary shows."

"It has been 20 years since I visited this museum . First time to visit the added museum - wow, incredible art exhibit ! What a cool collection of art and artist . The home preservation was nice and the glimpse into Diego's life , through the home and art collection , really enjoyed the whole experience . Not to be missed!!"

"La casa donde nació Diego Rivera convertida en museo sobre su vida y su obra, en la planta baja se conservan los muebles y pertenencias familiares, en los pisos superiores algunas pinturas y dibujos."

"This museum is nice enough, I suppose, but if you're going specifically for Diego Rivera you may come away disappointed. There really wasn't much of his work to be seen. I wouldn't budget more than maybe 40 minutes for this on the outside. Sadly the rooftop is closed for access to the public which is a shame as it looks like it would be promising for photos. Had I missed this I wouldn't have noticed."

"This is the house where Diego Rivera was born. It has been turned into a museum/art gallery featuring a re-creation of the house he grew up in, as well as an art gallery that houses both a collection of Diego Rivera's works, as well as rotating artworks from prominent Latin American artists. The concept and layout of the house was very interesting, and the price was worth it."

Título de la opinión: "Interesante por ser la casa en donde nació"
Opinión: "Esta atracción es interesante por ser la casa en donde nació este artista de talla internacional, pero no esperes ver muchas de sus obras, recomiendo solicitar apoyo de un guía para aprovechar la visita."

"Muy cerca del centro se encuentra la casa donde nació el pintor más importante de Mexico (hasta los seis años). Puedes encontrar diversos bosquejos de los inicios de Diego y varias obras de arte bastante interesantes (de otros autores) Si tu visita a Guanajuato es breve, no te gusta el arte o vienes con peques esta visita no es recomendada. Si te interesa el arte, visitala. La visita es rápida y cuesta $25 pesos."
"Si te gusta el arte. Te va a gustar. Si esperas algo de historia del pintor. Te queda a deber. Si llevas niños es un lugar aburrido para ellos."
"Interesante. Se pueden apreciar muebles de la época , como pinturas y otros de Diego como de otros artistas, hay sala dedicada a Frida. Visita es buena."

"The museum is a bit unassuming from the entrance, but once inside it is surprisingly good. The museum covers the rooms Diego and his family lived in, some of his art, and the art of many of his contemporaries, as well as contemporary art. The entrance fee is minimal (especially by US standards) and it is very close to the center of town. Its definitely worth a visit if you have any interest in Rivera."

"This was my third time in Guanajuanto and I wanted to see this museum. The experience was a bit of a let down. There isn't a lot to see here, and the "home" is just the building but no original belongings or rooms are on display. There was an art exhibit there, but again not that compelling. I would advise skipping this one in favor of the history museum if your time is limited."
"Waste of time. No major (or even minor works), but at least it's cheap. Best thing about the exhibit was the biscuit they give you upon leaving."
"Tienen que visitar este museo ya que es un icono de Guanajuato, por ser él oriundo de ese lugar, y por todo lo que aporta, sus pinturas excelentes, vale la pena visitarlo."
"Terrific experiance, birth home and many of hsi works and a seperate exhibit of south american and mexican artists great renovation."
"Me gustó mucho la visita a este museo, la casa es linda, austera y con una fuente hermosa, debes visitarla en tu próxima visita a Guanajuato…"
"Es realmente hermosa la cantidad de arte que encuentras en un solo sitio, costo accesible y totalmente recomendado."
"Bien organizado este museo además de obras del pintor mexicano, ofrece exposiciones intinerantes de primer nivel, es bien ubicado y de fácil acceso."

"If you are not a fan of Diego Rivera...then that is ok. As they had other artwork also on display. However if you want some translation of the artworks or any information, then you are on your own and hopefully the titles will be enough."
"Este museo es obligado, muy bien conservado , tiene muchos bosquejos y dibujos, imposible que Frida este ausente como no lo estuvo de su vida."
"Excelente museo, dinámico y sencillo, nada difícil ni tediosos, el precio de admisión es muy económico y el personal bastante amable, sin duda muy recomendable…"

"Es la segunda vez que visito este sitio, esperaba ver lo mismo de la vez pasada pero no fue así. Remodelaron un poco el lugar y verás pinturas de otros exponentes además de las de Diego y un poco de su vida en esta casa. ¡Lo recomiendo mucho!"

"Lindo museo como todos en México. El cuidado por la preservación y los detalles de circulación son siempre impecables. Las piezas no son muy interesantes, algunas obras de Diego son algo de las más intrascendentes y son escasas.  La ciudad es linda y durante una caminata es razonable entrar y pasear por 30 a 45 minutos disfrutando de la historia de Diego Rivera. No es un museo por el que esforzarse de más en visitar."
"¿Quién lo hará trata de la historia de México de que tarde o temprano Diego Rivera y su esposa. encuentro Frida Kahlo. Por esta razón, la visita a la cuna y el pequeño museo es una necesidad."

"Decidimos entrar porque muchas personas lo recomendaron... y así fue, tienen una exhibición de las pinturas más conocidas de Diego Rivera y parte de sus cosas de uso diario, esta restaurada la casa y tiene un Excelente personal."

"The Diego Rivera house gives you a good idea of what middle class life was like a hundred years ago, with much of the Rivera's original furniture on display. I do wish they had a few more of Diego's paintings. The temporary exhibits are not that interesting."

"Fuimos un dia que afortunadamente o desafortunadamente habia un grupo escolar como de 50 niños visitando el museo, considero que eso no me permitio disfrutar el museo como hubiera querido (ya que los niños ocupaban todo el espacio de las salas de exposicion tanto de historia como de obras de arte). No se que hacia una Frida Khalo disfrazada por ahi la verdad. Por otro lado el museo ofrece una muy buena exposicion de la historia y vida de Diego Rivera y sus obras."

"Si se encuentra en las huellas de Diego Rivera y Frida Kahlo supuesto, no podemos pasar por alto lo que una vez fue el lugar de nacimiento del gran muralista mexicano. En un caso diferente, poco probable que afecte curiosos."
"Muy bello, poca gente lo conoce, todos deberian de ir, al principio es una exposición de lo que era su casa y despues hay obras de él y otros pintores."
"Great history of Rivera. Loved the house and meandering through the various rooms which were staged with furnishings from the era. Favorite were the photographs."
"Si tienes tiempo es una buena opción para visitar, aunque hay cosas más bellas en la ciudad. Si quieres conocer más de Diego Rivera, es mejor seguir su pista en Coyoacan, Ciudad de México."
"Creí que encontraría algo diferente, como todo lo de diego Rivera, y aunque está muy bien , es mas que nada como una exposicion de arte."
"Es un museo que alberga diversas muestras de artistas nacionales e internacionales, obras de muy buena calidad. Y puedes ver obras de Diego Rivera."

"First part of the tour was Rivera's actual home where he lived with his parents. Pretty cool and then you keep climbing to the exhibit floors. The only work by Rivera were of early sketches. Rough drafts in one and pencil which he probably meant to throw away. The rest of the exhibits belonged to unknown artists pretty let down. Has clean restrooms."
"No solo las pinturas de Diego Rivera, tienen otras exposiciones de otros artistas estas son de temporada,excelentes obras de arte y la casa de exhibición es muy bonita."

Título de la opinión: "No debes perderte en tu visita a Guanajuato"
Opinión: "En si hay muy poco de Diego Rivera.. pero quisiera resaltar las exposiciones de artistas invitados (M. Pachecho Y Manjarrez)... ¡Espectacular su obra!"

"Visited the house where Diego Rivera was born. It was interesting to see his birth home and how it was fixed up for people to see how it looked when he was born. The first floor included a dining room and bedrooms of the family. Second and third floors were mainly exhibition rooms of some of his work and other works from various artists."

"La casa de Joven de Diego Rivera, convertida en museo, galería de sus pinturas y también hay exposiciones continuas de diferentes artistas, cuenta con un auditorio que esta adornado con fotografias d Diego y de su familia y un mural de su vida donde forma parte Frida Kalho , cuenta con un mirador desde donde se puede apreciar el centro de Guanajuato, recomendable."

"Consiga un guía, y haga más emotiva la visita, no cuenta con audio guía y si no es una persona que se detenga a leer le parecerá aburrido, con muebles del siglo XIX hace una reproducción de la casa, galerías llenas de arte y la combinación de arquitectura moderna."

Título de la opinión: "Well worth it for fans of Diego Rivera"
Opinión: "The museum works on two levels. For fans Rivera there is a good collection from his earlier work. In addition there is a wonderful Rivera mural re the history of Mexico. However do not expect lots of his later works. The museum also has a good collection of rooms furnished in period style."

"El museo se encuentra a unas cuadras de las principales atracciones de Guanajuato, es económico 25 pesos por adulto, esta dentro de la que fue casa natal de Rivera, son aproximadamente 3 pisos con exposiciones (hay un elevador), hay baños y una pequeña tienda de snacks, otra de libros y una mas de recuerdos. El museo cuenta con exposiciones de diferentes artistas. Esta muy bien iluminado y cuidado. Puedes además ver algunas habitaciones con los muebles de aquella época, en fin vale la pena ir y conocer algunos de los cuadros de las primeras obras de Rivera. No te recomiendo asistir con niños pequeños."

"The house this museum is in is charming and interesting architecturally. The art is beautiful and varied, and showcases the various stages and evolution of Rivera's artistic style. Additionally, the museum showcases work of other artists which we also enjoyed. It is very doable in an hour or so, and reasonably priced for the experience. Definitely worth a visit!"
"Las exposiciones estan increibles, el museo vale la pena, esta limpio, iluminado y moderno. esta muy bien organizado y te quedas con la boca abierta porque es para toda la familia."

"Set in his old home, and furnished for his era, this museum offers not only some works of the artist but works or many others as well. Most of these are exhibited in a modern section of the museum build next door."

Título de la opinión: "El arte de este gran muralista en Guanajuato"
Opinión: "Si visitas Guanajuato y te gusta el arte no dejes de visitar esta casa que es un hermoso museo con pinturas de Diego rivera ademas de los muebles de la epoca en la que el nacio y vivio en Guanajuato. Además hay exposiciones temporales de otros artistas, tuve la suerte de ver la exposicion de un pintor tapatio Jusn Carlos Manjarrez, 100% recomendado."

"Rivera spent here just 6 years of his life and the original house on the first floor is just a reconstruction. It gives you more of an idea how people lived in Guanajuato at the beginning of the 19th century. But first of all, the museum has enough of Rivera's early work to see how his artistic talent was evolving. That's part of the museum is indeed fascinating and definitely worth the time. There are also temporary exhibits in this museum, which often are of great value."

"Es la casa donde naciò, sòlo que no era su casa Està muy bien puesta y tiene salas dedicadas a otros artistas Recrean su habitaciòn natal y muestran parte de su obra. Esta bueno si te gusta el arte y si no conoces al artista también."

Título de la opinión: "Deja mucho que desear frente a su taller en San Angel , Cd. de México"
Opinión: "La verdad esperaba mucho más de éste recinto. Al escuchar que tenía la mayor cantidad de obras de Diego Rivera, se me hizo imposible perder la visita. En realidad lo que ves es la casa y el mobiliario de la casa de sus padres , que es interesante pero nada más. De las obras expuestas, la mayoría son solamente bosquejos y alguna que otra obra bonita, pero solamente eso..."

"Bastante interesante la exposición en la casa de Diego Rivera, hay muchos bocetos, pinturas y trazos, que nunca han sido famosos. Aunque la historia de Diego Rivera, se conoce mas por ser el revolucionario de México y eso también debería estar en la casa.  Solo muestran estilo de vida y lo demás son pinturas."

Título de la opinión: "Si vas es por ver arte y no precisamente de Diego"
Opinión: "Debes venir a este lugar con la plena conciencia de que las exposiciones ofrecidas seran el 80%-90% de otros artistas, muy buenas tambien, pero que quede claro lo unico que veras de Diego Rivera seran unos bocetos de lapiz o pluma de dos o tres obras que realizo y que la casa fue en la que vivio solo hasta los 6 años, ni vivio alli con Frida ni nada por el estilo, es mas bien un museo de arte contemporaneo, lo cual no deja de ser atractivo. Lo que si me parecio en verdad desagradable es la platica que dio un autonombrado mason, que como se cree dueño de la verdad se va duro contra todo, la Iglesia, el gobierno, los Heroes Mexicanos, la sociedad, contra los mismos oyentes de la platica, no los baja de ignorantes, solo porque dice que estudio uno o dos diplomados de historia ya encontro el hilo negro, con un lenguaje menos grosero podria demostrar mas cultura y enfocarse mas en la platica de la vida de Diego que me quede esperando, eso si al final pide su generosa propina."

Título de la opinión: "Disappointing - No Real Feel For Diego In These Walls"
Opinión: "I had been looking so forward to visiting Rivera's home, but was disappointed that one can no longer sense what it might have been like in his early years. I enjoyed seeing a number of his project sketches, but beyond several photographs of the artist, little of his ghost remains. Today, more emphasis is given exhibitions of contemporary Mexican artists. I have no objection to this, but the "museum" factor overshadows the "house" frature. If you've visited any of Diego and Frida's homes, workshops, or museum in Mexico City, you'be be disappointed that there is so little of them in this project. Nevertheless, I'm glad I visited where he lived for the first six years of his life. Admission is only $25MEX and kids are free."

"Museo que cuenta con salas para exhibir piezas de arte sin embargo el gran atractivo es mostrar el arte de este gran pintor lllamado Diego Rivera y aunque sus trabajos más importantes se encuentran en otros museos lo que más me gustó fueron los bocetos a lápiz de sus obras más famosas,si andas por él área definitivamente no podrás dejar de ir a este gran exhibición de este personaje que engrandeció a México con obras increíbles."

"This place is an absolute must. It is one of the best displays of early wealth in this area. It is a huge estate that has been visited by many dignitaries in the past. Beautiful art pieces and furniture."
"Guanajuato tiene todo , no podían faltar los museos, este es bueno para quien le guste este tipo de pintores."
"Algo de historia de este muralista mexicano desde su desliz con el cubismo hasta réplica de uno de sus mejores murales, su casa su vida…"

Título de la opinión: "Lindo lugar, aunque siempre se espera un poco más"
Opinión: "La representacion de la casa, el mobiliario, y parte de su historia son agradables, aunque este realizada en la planta baja y no en el sitio original de la casa."

"I was hoping to see more substantial work of Diego Rivera displayed here, instead the museum has other artists' work occupied most of the spaces of two of the floors. I assumed that this would be the home and museum of Diego Rivera and was wrong, so was caught surprised when walking into the exhibitions of others. The photos of him visiting were nice to see though. It's worth the visit."

"Un lugar maravilloso, que te envuelve, que te hace suspirar,que te invita a soñar y deleitar tu pupila de extremo a extremo, simplemente divino... lo unico que lamente fue su hora de cierre jejeje, ¡Nunca es suficiente!"
"Estupenda conservación del inmueble de la casa natal de Diego Rivera. Gran fachada de color rojo. Un imperdible de Guanajuato."
"Siempre es lindo ver obras de Rivera. Este museo también exhibe obras de otros artistas. Un actor recrea a Diego y va actuando y explicando partes de la casa."
"Casa donde nació Digo Rivera. Algunas salas muestran mobiliario de la época. Amplia exposición de obras del artista, complementado con muestras de otros."

"It was nice to visit the home of Diego Rivera, and while the decor was original, we have seen more of his work in other cities. Don't get me wrong, it's worth visiting, if nothing else for the decor, but we were not blown away by the exhibit itself."
"I enjoyed seeing the early works and sketches of Diego Rivera but felt like the newer section did not enhance the older section. It felt a little overdone to me."

"Edad y es algo anodino que no hay lugar donde el recientemente otro lado de miedo o no sesgada, como el rellano de la escalera. Diego estaba interesado en conocer la vida de esa época en lugar de saber lo que era la gente."
"Diego house is shown here. Unfortunately there is Not a lot in the exhibition . Many paints are currently in Japan. A bit disappointing. Better ask if their best paints are back home."
"Diego Rivera nace en Guanajuato. Su lugar de nacimiento en el museo. Diego funciona y en el momento de los muebles está decorado como es, hay un espectacular, pero pequeña."

"Como un lugar para ver obras de Rivera, prefieren sus murales en la Ciudad de México Museo Dolores Olmedo o. Esta casa, así como la Casa de Frida Kahlo, mata la curiosidad de saber donde nació el artista y vivió de niño. Además de los primeros trabajos del artista, el espacio con varios pisos - la casa es amplia y hermosa - tiene exposiciones de otros artistas."

"A worth while visit..and suggest you have some one with you that speaks Spanish...to further explain about the exhibits.. One of the rooms where there are artifacts..there are sheets of explanations in English."

"Es una visita obligada en Guanajuato. La casa es linda con las habitaciones ambientadas en la época de infancia de Rivera. También se presenta obra de Diego y de otros contemporáneos (como Orozco y Siqueiros). Adultos mayores y estudiantes pagan tarifa con descuento."

"Museum was nice. It has multiple floors that showcase other artists. When we visited much of Diego's work was on loan to other international museums. Yet, what made up for not seeing Diego ' s work were the exhibits of Orozco and Siqueiros - both amazing and as historically important artists."
"I really enjoyed the Diego Rivera Museum. There were interesting displays from other artists as well."
"Great building and nice selection of Diego's artwork, also great exhibitions and beautiful building. Loved it!"

"This museum really gives you insight into the life of Diego Rivera without putting all the attention on his wife, Frida Kalho. Many drawings and sketches on display that he used to design his famous murals. The house has authentic decor; a nice mixture of museum and gallery."

"Diego Rivera is one of Mexico's most prominent artist. It is the home and birth place of Diego Rivera and converted into a museum displaying his works and restoring the house to re create it as it was at the time of his birth. The staff are exteme knowledge and passionate about the artist and the art displayed in the museum. The museum is located on the north side of the historic center of Guanajuato and is spread across three floors displaying a variety of his art work to show how he passed through various disciplines and styles. Seeing his work in such an intimate setting really is something special. In addition they also have some interesting exhibits of contemporary artist. Definitely worth a visit. Picture taking is not allowed."

"Exposición de Diego las cuales muestran otras exposiciones temporales de altísimo nivel!! Igual hay paseos con guías, si no eres muy conocedor de arte puedes contratar uno, pero el museo está simplemente para admirar el arte."
"Visitar esta bella ciudad y no ir a la casa de Diego Rivera es como nunca haber estado en Guanajuato. es mas que recomendable es parte de nuestra historia contemporanea."

"Diego's artwork exhibition is very complete, from the beginnings to his famous murals. Other temporary exhibitions were also interesting. Very big mistake to don't open the children's room and the t-shirt store on Sundays."

"We thoroughly enjoyed this museum which is in Diego Rivera's home from birth to age 5 or so. This museum has some of the home restored to the time of his life spent there as well as a great deal of art including a fabulous mural in a theater room. We were accompanied by a tour guide who was showing us the city. He helped us understand the characters and meaning of the mural. We enjoyed it all very much."
"Se pueden apreciar bastantes obras de arte de muchas personas no solo de Diego Rivera y de muchos estilos."
"Si bien el museo no goza de las mejores piezas de Diego (a mí entender sus murales). Nos guía por la variedad de estilos que atravesó el artista, sin lugar a duda de los mejores Latinoamericanos."
"Es una exposición compartida con otros artistas no tan conocidos... La casa es donde Diego vivió de niño muy ordenado y moderno a la vez."

"Padrísimo y hermosísima exposición de Diego, y tienen otras exposiciones temporales de altísimo nivel. Igual hay paseos con guías, si no eres muy conocedor de arte puedes contratar uno, pero el museo está como para sentarte y meterte a cada pintura unos 15 minutos y con guías esto no es posible, es realmente hermoso. ¡¡Súper recomendado!!"

Título de la opinión: "Diego Rivera - Lugar de nacimiento y la exposición de algunas de sus obras"
Opinión: "El lugar de nacimiento de Diego Rivera (también conocido como un compañero de la vida de Frida Kahlo) está situado en el centro histórico de Guanajuato. Es una mezcla de museo de su origen, la información acerca de su trabajo - y lo más importante, también hay fotografías, dibujos y otras obras de su visita. se obtiene una buena visión general de su vida y su obra."

"We've been to many Rivera/Kahlo exhibits in different cities. This is a unique opportunity to see his earlier work, including drawings and sketches he did as a student. Look closely and see the genius that created the famous paintings and murals later on.
YES there are stairs here! The elevator was not working; I don't know how often that happens."

"We were on a day trip to Guanajuato from San Miguel and one of our party really wanted to see this museum. Diego Rivera only lived here as a child for about 6 years- the furniture is not his family's, but is of the era. One floor was set as the home, one displayed early works and sketches of the artist and one floor had traveling exhibits. It was ok but we left sort of underwhelmed. I can see why the city wants to honor him and preserve his home, but it was not particularly illuminating. If you are only in town one day, there may be other sights more interesting."

"En la exposición se revive el origen de Diego Rivera y se aprecia el estilo de vida en sus primeros años. Además se exhiben obras de arte por época y los distintos movimientos artísticos por los cuales fue evolucionando. Inevitablemente debes de apreciar su obra llamada post guerra."
"This is a small place but has an interesting collection of furniture and photos from Diego Rivera's childhood and family. Also a collection of his artwork and related pieces,sketches, etc."
"Murals in the chapel should not be missed. Mostly a collectionof his early sketches. Not a single Rivera painting. Interesting nonetheless."

"La casa de la infancia de Diego restaurado a tan bueno como vivo. Un agradable paseo a través de! Sin embargo, las pinturas son captadores de atención reales. ¡Muchos estilos diferentes y todas preciosas!"
"It is nicely laid out with much needed air conditioning on the hot day. I wanted to see more of Frida of course."
"I enjoyed visiting this museum. It is nicely maintained, with some beautiful art work, both from Diego Rivera and his friends and colleagues."

Título de la opinión: "La casa de la infancia de Rivera"
Opinión: "Esta casa era yod Rivera vivió hasta los 6 años de edad. Siguen siendo los muebles y cuadros de la época que ayuda mucho a entender el principio de su vida artística. Merece la pena ir."
"I only knew Diego Rivera as Frida Khalo's husband but after touring his home and works I have a much better appreciation of what a true visionary he was."

"The museum is a lovely piece of architecture to begin with. It is partially in the restored house where he was born and spent his early years. I love the paintings and was fascinated with the sketches he had done as a prelude to painting, I believe. While I thoroughly enjoyed it, I wished to see even more of his work. I could have spent another hour there."
"En excelente estado de conservación, muy buenos trabajos expuestos (no sólo de Diego Rivera), la gente en recepción y el museo muy amable y accesible."

"Allí vivió hasta la edad de seis años. Además de los muebles que adornan la casa en ese momento, el museo cuenta con una excelente colección del artista. Tiene una pequeña tienda con algunas ofertas."
"Un museo que esta muy interesante, esta muy completo y se aprende, y te das cuenta de cosas que ni te imaginas aunque esta pequeño el museo pero bonito."
"Hermoso espacio , conocer la obra de Diego Rivera es asombrosa , y acondicionaron muy bien el inmueble , moderno com altos techos . Pequeño pero muy recomendable."

"La casa está muy cuidada y la información que se expone es clara. También las exposiciones temporales son muy interesantes. Es una lástima que no tengan abierta la terraza, que supongo que funcionaba como cafetería. Además, la tienda tiene muy pocos objetos."

"La arquitectura de la casa es muy linda. La "ambientación" de la decoración no tiene el picante que uno esperaría encontrar. Sorprendentes las exposiciones temporales, con artistas de excelente creatividad y calidad."
"Anything to do with Diego Rivera has to be seen, he was quite a man. This house is where he lived for his initial six years, and it has been restored quite well. Must do."

Título de la opinión: "Es una bonita finca pero uno espera mas efectos personales"
Opinión: "En la finca solo vivió de los 1 a los 6 años no era propiedad de sus padres arrendaban solo el 1er piso, la finca fue un tanto transformada con formato museo y uno va con la idea de ver la finca real, las obras son muy interesantes pero sin reseña de cuando se pinto o cual fue el fin por lo que es como galería no museo. El personal tiene una excelente actitud eso lo reconozco e hizo un del recorrido algo muy interesante que si vale la pena visitar y mas por su cercanía a la universidad o plazuela, la gente de tercera edad subia por las escaleras nadie les dijo del elevador y daban pena preocupante."

"Si bien el museo casa Diego Rivera te llevará a recordar a uno de los mejores pintores muralistas de nuestro país, sus espacios, su forma de vida... Tener la oprtunidad de observar sus obras originales es realmente único. A los amantes del arte no se lo pueden perder. 
Quien vaya con niños hay una biblioteca donde estos pequeños acompañados de un adulto pueden esperar."

"Strangely, there is very little biographical information about Rivera at the museum. The artwork was interesting, but would have been more so if we had had more context. There was information in English on some of the walls of the gallery, but it was poorly translated from Spanish and so not very helpful. In the projection room, there are many group photos but none of them are captioned. This museum is on 3 or 4 levels, and you must climb many stairs. On the positive side, in the gift shop we found an excellent map of Guanajuato (30 pesos), which I had been looking for ages."
"Sólo un edificio de nueva construcción en el lugar de nacimiento de la fundación nacida Diego Rivera pasó su infancia. No hay que esperar que lo hará muy beneficioso para la salud."

"In this house, Diego Rivera lived the first years of his life and has a limited but interesting exhibition of the work of the great Mexican painter. Some temporary exhibition rooms in a 3 story house. It's actually much better the House of Frida, but this is a good opportunity for those who know little about the life and work of Rivera."
