"Es muy bonito el museo y muestra arquitectura antigua y la actual... existen muchaaaas salas de expocisión y no solo de Diego Rivera... Una parte muestra la casa donde vivié Diego hasta los 6 años... Muy lindo ... es algo largo… Pero vale la pena"
"Liked the art and displays. Two invited artists had art during our visit. Amazing paintings. Had this place since the beginning in my places to go."
"Great art by DR and others can be seen here, and the layout of the house is interesting. Good value for the admission fee."

Título de la opinión: "A very compact view of Diego Rivera"
Opinión: "This was quite brilliant of Rivera's family to turn his birth home into a museum. Since the home retains a few elements and descriptions of the home, it takes you back a bit. Then you get to enjoy some of his art. To those who don't know much about him (like me) you will see various styles you would not associate with him."

Título de la opinión: "Nos gustó la exposición permanente en este lugar"
Opinión: "Las obras que se presentan permanentemente en este lugar, sobre todo las de Diego Rivera, son increíbles y deben admirarse. El museo es interesante por que además de exhibir esas piezas de arte, recrea la casa en la que vivió el Maestro hasta las seis años."
"Lovely collection of Diego Rivera along with other artists that were well-displayed. Further museum expansion was in the works. Very good value for the money."

"I've been to Frida's house in Coyocan several times, as well as their house in San Ange (both in Mexico City.) This hotel is simply great. It has many paintings by Diego and the house has a history that is very interesting. One hour is plenty-well worth seeing."
"Una forma de conocer más de Diego Rivera: su periodo francés, sus ilustraciones de leyendas precolombinas, así como la reconstrucción de la casa donde nació (hasta hay un moisés). Muy recomendable."

"This charming and elegant house museum provides some insight of the life of young Diego Rivera. Lower floors are furnished by the Rivera family with antiques of the period when Diego was a lad. Higher floors are gallery space with portraits and sketches. This little intimate museum is very interesting and worthwhile. The price is extremely reasonable. One of my favourite sights in Guanajuato."

"Es importante conocer la casa donde nació uno de los más talentosos pintores y muralistas que ha visto nacer México. Aunque la visita se disfruta mucho más si eres un amante del trabajo de Diego Rivera, personalmente no me atrae tanto sus obras de arte, pero de que se tiene que visitar este museo se tiene que visitar porque además se exponen algunos objetos personales del pintor y varias exposiciones temporales de otros artistas talentosos. De fácil acceso y precios accesibles."

"We enjoyed our visit to Diego's home. The home shows life in a typical home for the time period that his family would have lived in the property. It is worth a stop in for a visit to learn more about this iconic artist and his youth."

"Por unos pocos pesos se puede visitar la casa (e incluso la habitación) en la que nació este pintor y artista polifacético que fue Diego Rivera. Gran parte de la decoración es única, algunos otros muebles donados por su hija a la composición del museo, que también incluye parte de la impresionante colección de su obra, distribuye cronológicamente en su creación. No se pierda la pintura increíble que hizo cuando tenía sólo 12 años de edad. Debido a Diego Rivera es mucho más que la problemática relación con Frida Kahlo."

"La inmediatez y cercanía con obras de Diego es extraordinaria. Creo que una área de souveniers ( playeras, litografias, etc) como hay en mucho museos de USA además de poder ser un ongreso extra para el Museo, propiciaría una mayor difusión de la existencia de este excelente Museo. La Fundación que administra el Mueso debería promover un grupo de AMIGOS de DIEGO Y FRIDA como el Guggenheim y mucho otros Museos que acercan a la gente hacia ellos."
"This was an excellent place to be become acquainted with Rivera's multi-faceted styles and life. Visit the library where a knowledgeable librarian will add even more to your visit."

"For a few dollars, you can visit the charming birthplace of Diego Rivera. You can even see the room where he was born, including his wrought iron bassinet. Much of the décor is original, the rest donated by his daughter. In addition, there is an impressive collection of his work, arranged in order of its creation. Don't miss the incredible painting he did at the age of 12. Even if you are not an art fan, you should take the time to see this place."

"Diego Rivera is one of Mexico's greatest artists. The house where he was born was converted in a museum. On the first floor there are a lot of furniture from late 1800's on the second and third floor there's the most impressive collection of his work. It's a 20 pesos entrance fee. Worth it. "
"Had to go here and it is really neat to see the house and see some of his work, he was an amazing artist with an incredible life story."
"Para los apasionados de Diego, es una visita obligada ir a conocer su casa. El lugar es de facil acceso y cualquiera te dirá como llegar."

"Al verlo por fuera nunca te imaginas la cantidad de obras que tienen en exposición. Los recorridos incluyen tres niveles y cada paso que se da dentro es una sorpresa por ver como manifestaba su arte Diego. Revisa bien los horarios porque si cierran. Tiene una pequeña tienda de souvernirs al entrar y los precios de los souvenirs son muy accesibles. Recuerda que Guanajuato es para caminar, subir y bajar."

"Es importante recorrerlo y apreciar las obras ,aunque en otros lugares también se pueden apreciar lo murales imponentes,de este famoso y controvertido pintor.Su lugar y sus pertenencias te transportan a su época."

"Muy padre, muy bonito. Pude apreciar diferentes etapas artisticas de Maestro que para mi eran desconocidas., En el ultimo piso encontramos trabajos muy interesantes de artistas de la localidada. Vale la pena visitarlo."
"Me llamo la atencion encontrar este museo en la Ciudad de Guanajuato , realmente es un gusto que sigamos fomentando la cultura y la admiracion por nuestros grandes maestros Mexicanos."

"Caminando por las calles de Gto, mi familia y yo vislumbramos el museo-casa de Diego Rivera y no quedamos decepcionados. Si no conoces la vida de este célebre pintor y muralista mexicano, aún así te recomendaría la visita, conocerás su vida y arte, así como muebles y objetos auténticos del artista. Me encantó."
"This was my favorite museum in GTO, giving me an appreciation for DR's work beyond the murals and more famous pieces."

"Tiene una tienda de alimentación con Diego y Frida, una tienda de libros y una biblioteca infantil con libros de diferentes países y las historias sin historia, pero lo mejor son aún pinturas móviles y Diego Rivera, su historia también está ahí, para aquellos que conocen la Casa azul en la Ciudad de México también ir a Guanajuato conocer sus pinturas y dibujos, es increíble, fui cuatro veces en el museo y cada vez, mirando las mismas imágenes, tenía nuevas ideas sobre ¡Y no es caro para entrar!"
"La casa es donde Diego Rivera vivió su infancia, cuenta con varios pisos en donde puedes observar su recamara, al igual que la de sus padres, cuenta con una colección de dibujos y de pinturas."

Título de la opinión: "UN LUGAR QUE NO TE PUEDES PERDER"
Opinión: "Un lugar que no te puedes perder, conocer y admirar lo que ahí se tiene, es de verdad una obra de arte, muy rustica pero muy llena de antigüedad y arte."

"This the elegant childhood home of Diego Rivera with an attached art gallery of his work and the art of contemporary Mexican artists. The home offers a peek at elegance in 19th century Guanajuato and the gallery is lovely."

Título de la opinión: "Interesting & Intimate View of the Artist as a Boy"
Opinión: "An interesting and intimate view of the house where Diego Rivera was born and lived as a small boy. The house serves as a museum/gallery with the first of the three floors furnished with the Rivera family's 19th century antiques and furniture. It feels as if you are walking into someone's home, into the past. The second and third floors have some of Rivera's portraits of peasants and indigenous people and a nude of Frida Kahlo. There are also some early sketches of some of the artist's more famous murals. If you're in Guanajuato, it's well worth a stop here. There's a nice gift shop, too, and it's also an easy walk from the main plaza. If you've seen Rivera's big murals and other works in Mexico City, this little museum may not be that impressive, but I find it always interesting to see where famous people got their start in life, and I think an exploration of Rivera's first home adds something of value to the image. No need for a tour guide as you can browse on your own, but if a stop here is included in a tour all the better."
"Tons of Diego Rivera pieces. Don't miss the one upstairs with all the faces. If you like Rivera, or like art, you will really like this tour. Its also not that expensive."

"Exhibits were great for showing the development of his art and painting style. It was like a miniature art history lesson to see how he tried out various styles from classical through impressionist and cubism and on into his own unique productions."
"Desde la arquitectura de la casa que es mjuy bonita, tiene varios pisos, hay muebles de la epoca y de la familia de Diego Rivera, cuenta con pinturas hermosas, es tipo museo."

Título de la opinión: "Everything you wanted to know about Diego Rivera"
Opinión: "This childhood home of Diego Rivera is a wonderful view into his background along with examples of his work. On the top floor, there is a wonderful research library devoted to Rivera and his work available for students and "civilians" who are interested in researching Rivera and his work to us."
"Pensar donde nacio Diego Rivera ya es importante, Es muy visitado por lo que representa en la pintura para México."

"Interesting museum set in Diego Rivera's birthplace with period furnishings of how it must have been, housing some of his early paintings (reflecting different styles) and galleries with works by other artists. Very good timeline of Diego on second floor courtyard--I actually learn some things I didn't know, but you do need to know Spanish. There's pictures of Diego's visit to the site in the theatre upstairs. Admission: 20 pesos and worth it."

"La casa contiene una buena colección de dibujos, esuqmes y pinturas de la trayectoria inicial de Diego Rivera, es un buen escape a la historia y apreciación conceptual del México en 1900, además cerca de ahi, hay un lugar para tomar café exquisito."

"La casa de los papás de Diego Rivera, esta acondicionada como museo, la entrada con credencial cuesta la mitad, es interesante ver este lugar, pues muesta algo de la historia de uno de nuestros grandes artistas."

"Nos gusto mucho la Casa de Diego Rivera porque tiene muchas obras del famoso pintor... las pinturas se muestran en orden cronológico y esto esta perfecto porque permite de comprender como cambio la pintura de Diego entre los años. ¡¡Nos costó 20 pesos, súper vale la pena!!"

Título de la opinión: "Interesting collection of his paintings in Diego's childhood home"
Opinión: "A must-see for Diego Rivera fans (and who isn't?). You'll see how he painted before choosing his mural style. Also has special exhibitions in the new wing. A small gift shop."

"My daughter and I were thrilled to be able to visit the Diego Rivera Museum! It was a wonderful experience to see the scope and depth of the man's talent and how it evolved.  The variety of artwork, both Rivera's and that of modern artists and the way in which it is displayed made for a very stimulating and enjoyable experience. Well worth the time to see this museum and the price is right, too."
"Una casa llena de historia de Diego Rivera. Estan muchos de sus retratos. Fue un gusto poder visitarlo. Esta muy bien organizado.Y la entrada es económica."

"Mi recomendación siempre lleva tu credencial que te habilite como estudiante, maestro o persona de la tercera edad por que así solo pagas $5 pesos ya que no hay mucho que ver de la casa eso si en los pisos superiores hay pinturas y unas estatuas de diego y frida si te gusta las pinturas de diego ve si no eres amante de esto mejor ve a otro museo."

"I was so excited to be able to visit Diego Rivera's house. The entrance fee was so cheap. They have cordoned off the old bit of the house which remains how it was when Diego lived there. They have also added a new section which displays artwork by other, more contemporary artists."

Título de la opinión: "Para los amantes de la pintura y de Diego Rivera"
Opinión: "Hermosa reconstrucción de la casa del pintor. Está la trayectoria pictórica del artista , su etapa impresionista y cubista.Hay una completa biografía del pintor. Muy interesante."

"I really enjoyed this small museum. By touring the rooms that Rivera and his family actually lived in and hearing their story, you learn about where he was coming from in his life and art. Definitely take the tour-short but insightful. The upper levels are an art museum which is still developing. His early works were a surprise and the other Mexican artists' works put the era in perspective. The newest room was not yet staged so there will be new works soon. My only regret is that the amount of time we allotted for our visit was too short. A minimum of 45 mins. is necessary to not feel rushed. Just do it at your own pace and don't be rushed. The admission is very little, a plus. The gift shop is sparse but new things are coming in. I can see it being rated excellent once everything is in place, keeping in mind that the space is fairly small."

Título de la opinión: "Para empezar a seguirle la pista a Diego Rivera"
Opinión: "Si te interesa la cultura mexicana seguro que te interesan las figuras de Diego Rivera y Frida Kahlo.Si es así y estás en Guanajuato, esta visita es imprescindible. De camino uno puede imaginarse cómo vivía una familia de medios de la época. Merece la pena detenerse en el mural con los personajes mexicanos considerados fundamentales por Diego Rivera."

Título de la opinión: "Museo que cambia la perspectiva sobre Diego"
Opinión: "Nunca pensé que la Casa de Diego Rivera albergara tantas obras. Por fuera, la casona guanajuatense se percibe pequeña, pero una vez dentro, el edificio permite caminar por los cuartos reconstruidos de lo que habría sido la casa donde nació y creció Diego Rivera. Después, los pisos superiores dejar ver su faceta de pintor de caballete, que si bien no fue la principal, fue la inicial y permiter adentrarse en su obra más allá de los archi-reconocidos murales. Si bien, la expectativa que Diego Rivera plantea pudiera no ser alcanzada, es un museo para profundizar en su obra y en su tiempo como pintor mexicano con un profundo compromiso estético y social."
"Interesting, but limited b/c we don't know Spanish and all signs are in Mexico. Nobody there to help understand what is in the museum."

"We accidentally stumbled upon it, and it was a nice surprise. Not just wonderful art, but history as well. Not just an art gallery, but period furnishings too. A great way to learn more about Diego Rivera. English friendly!"

Título de la opinión: "Great view into a slice of Diego Rivera's life, plus more"
Opinión: "There is art by not only Rivera but other artists, and some of the rooms where Diego lived as a child. Well selected."

"To see the evolution of Diego's style from his childhood on up was a delight. The combination of seeing where he spent his early childhood and his works really gave one the sense of understanding this complicated individual a little better. If you are a Diego fan this is a must stop."

"Quise ir al museo pensando que iba ser algo para turistas.. algo solo para hacer dinero de la gente que quiere ir solo para decir que visitaron la casa de Diego Rivera! Que sorpresa me lleve cuando mire todo lo que tiene este museo! Muy barata la entrada, y vale la pena la caminada! Pisos de obras originales de Diego. Pero no vayas con intento de ver algo de Frida, las obras son solo de Diego. Articulos de niñez y mucha historia. ¡¡¡Me encanto!!! Eso si, lleven efectivo si quieren comprar el libro del museo por que no aceptan tarjeta y no lo encuentro para pedirlo en linea :("

"El precio que pagas por estar en la casa en la que nació Diego Rivera es alto pues aparte de conservar algunos muebles y detalles yo esperaba algo más interesante. En la parte alta ofrecen exposiciones fotográficas y de otros artistas que pueden resultar más interesantes que la casa en sí."

"It's a must when you are in Mexico to go to Guanajuato and visit Diego Rivera home and museum. It's within walking historic center,close to most attractions. The museum shows a lot of his work, a small library and some works of local artist. Carmen is very informative of the life and work of Diego ."

"No sólo la obra de Frida maestro puede ser visto, sino también los muebles de una época que no volverá, tiene actividades culturales y cuenta con biblioteca de lectura para niños en el interior del edificio y sigue siendo un colecciones locales de ventas de la librería y una pequeña tienda en el interior. ¡Súper Recomendado!"

Título de la opinión: "Birthplace of one of the greatest 20th c Mexican artists"
Opinión: "This is a charming small museum, the ground floor has a reconstruction of what the living rooms would have been like, rather dark and uncomfortable. Upstairs there are a number of paintings and drawings by Diego Rivera, some of them quite outstanding. There is now a new extension, very modern with contemporary Mexican works, though the building is interesting, what is on show at present here is less so."

Título de la opinión: "Small museum like house with the painter memorabilia"
Opinión: "Nice experience to see the house and his memorabilia, the visit can be done in 30 minutes or less. It´s within walking distance from the tunnel and the city center."

"Una adición interesante para aquellos que conocen el trabajo y la vida de Diego Rivera. El documental que se presenta en Rivera es un modelo de lo que no se debe hacer al llevar a cabo este tipo de documental."

Título de la opinión: "Para los fanáticos de Diego... y para los no tanto"
Opinión: "Uno de los museos imperdibles de Guanajuato ya que es un lugar con verdadera historia, el lugar en donde vivió en su infancia uno de sus grandes hijos. Si lo que buscas es una colección de sus obras más famosas... lamento decirte que aquí no las encontrarás, ya que principalmente hallarás bocetos de algunos de sus murales y obras de sus etapas más tempranas que sin embargo si te permitirán entender mejor la vida y obra de este artista. También hay exposiciones temporales de otros artistas inspirados por Diego. El precio es muy accesible y está muy cerca caminando (en la misma calle) de los mejores museos de Guanajuato: la Alhóndiga de Granaditas, el museo del siglo XIX, el museo del pueblo y la Universidad de Guanajuato."
"Muy bonito museo, es la casa en donde nació el famoso pintor, hay algunas veces exposiciones temporales visita ampliamente recomendada."
"Conocer una casa de la época, cómo vivían las personas, además de las obras que se albergan en su interior."
"On the smallish side, but very interesting to see the rooms laid out as they once were, and a nice selection of paintings."
"Nice, spacious museo. Some Rivera and other artists on display. First I knew he was persona non grata in his home country. Worth a visit."

Título de la opinión: "Worth it if you're an art history buff"
Opinión: "This house has lots of olde worlde atmosphere. There is not a lot of the original house on display, but what can be seen is lovely. The family only occupied part of this home originally, so its close to what they actually lived in, and the rest, which contains the art museum, was acquired later. I almost didn't get to see the museum because of the stairs, but one of the staff took me to a back elevator and kindly gave us a bit of an ad hoc tour, which was most appreciated. So for anyone handicapped by stairs, just ask the staff to use the elevator (the notice on the elevator says it is for staff only). We had trouble finding the place by foot, and ended up taking a taxi, only to find we were just around the corner from it, but we'd walked miles in a circle - so take the taxi in the first place. "

"Beautifully preserved boyhood home of Diego Rivera. We took the guided tour and the gentleman who gave it was incredibly painstaking and detailed about every aspect of Rivera's life and the displays and art works. Fascinating and one of a kind."

Título de la opinión: "Para los fanáticos de Diego y su amada esposa"
Opinión: "Una cantidad impresionante de obras y algo de historia sobre este polémico y popular artista. Vale la pena recorrerlo mientras se hace un break del turismo convencional."
"Unexpected selection, not common for a town of this size. We enjoyed art, never seen before. A treat for people who are attached to Freda and Diego."

"Excelente museo de vida y ora de este Gran artista mexicano, nos ofrece un panorama de cómo vivía además de ofrecernos todas las etapas de Diego como artista, cuenta con muy buenos cuadros de Diego."

"Se debe ir a visitar la casa de Diego Rivera, no creo que sea la mejor colección de su obra, pero es buena. Tienen exposiciones temporales y están agrandando el museo. En la 1ra planta hay una señorita que platica los libros publicados de la obra de Diego es muy amena y hace un trabajo excelente."

"No tomes ninguno de los tours en camionetas que ofrecen en hoteles y en la calle solo te llevan de compras y a sitios sin interes histórico museos que no son museos solo casas de la risa todo te queda caminando o en taxi mas fácil, Las obras las aprecias super cerca esta de maravilla!! los muebles hermosos altamente recomendable."

"Extremely valuable and enjoyable little museum located in a three storey building not far from the Alhondiga de Granaditas. It exhibits early work from Rivera (the earliest piece is from when he was only 12). It is interesting because you can clearly identify how Rivera experimented with several techniques and styles before finding his own style. Its amazing how he really excelled at most techniques that he tried. If you like art, this is a must see in Guanajuato."

Título de la opinión: "Nice small museum with a few interesting paintings"
Opinión: "This is the house in which Diego Rivera was born, but most of the furnishings are not original. In the galleries they have a few of his paintings. The most interesting are those from his early days, when he was painting in the style of other artists and you can see his evolution as a painter."

"Es la casa donde vivió Diego Rivera hasta los 6 años de edad, sus padres rentaban ahi un cuarto. La colección de obras son bocetos de los inicios artísticos de Diego, ES TODO UN FRAUDE, PUEDEN DEJAR DE IR Y SE AHORRAN LOS 35 PESOS."
"Hermosas exposiciones de arte en los cinco niveles de la casa en la que crecio el maestro Diego Rivera, cover de 5 miseros pesos, algo escondido pero preguntando seguro llegas."

"This was a great discovery. Hadn't realized Rivera was born in Guanajuato. First floor is composed of rooms that are restored as they would have been while he was growing up. The upper floors contain collections devoted mostly his earlier works when he dabbled in different styles before finding his unique style concentrating on Mexican folk art figures and expressionistic murals and the like."
"Tiene mucha historia, sólo que esta un poco descuidada, además de que no hay quien te de una explicación de todo lo que hay en la casa."

"Yo no sé como es que la ciudad tiene tan admirables hijos y no les dan tanta importancia, DIEGO es uno de los grandes asi como IBARGÜENGOITIA y pienso que la esculturita que hicieron es penosamente insultante para este maestraso; poner a Diego Rivera de 150 cuando media 190 aprx. y al lado de un Basurero...pone en duda la cultura de la ciudad y del conocimiento cultural de sus gobernantes...y en un jardín que no recuerdo donde está, mientras pues ahi estabamos descubrimos la tumba de IBARGÜENGOITIA, no dice quien es y ni el año ni nada, asi como un pelado cualquiera. deberían tener un epitafio digno y una escultura del señor escritor. que pena..."

Título de la opinión: "Un poco escondido pero vale la pena"
Opinión: "Es sumergirte en la vida de diego rivera, tiene muchas obras y bosquejos que te envían a la forma de pensar de un personaje tan importante como lo fue el. En la parte superior de la casa hay una sala de exhibicion de obras de otros artistas contemporáneos muy recomendable."

"This three story home was the first home of Diego Rivera. The ground floor shows the typical furniture and layout of a home of the early 20th century. The upper floors have early artworks of Diego Rivera, which gives a great introduction to how his work developed into his later style.. There is a very modern museum being built or undergoing renos, incorporated into the home and beside it which was not open, but it will be wonderful, once open. A beautiful marriage of traditional and ultra modern."

"I very much enjoyed visiting this museum which is located in the building where Diego Rivera was born. The museum is divided into the various different periods of Rivera's painting career. Many interesting paintings and sketches that I had never seen before. It also gives a lot of information about his life, his connections, etc. I highly recommend a visit to this museum. It's in walking distance from the centro."

"It is interesting to see the kind of house Rivera lived in growing up. Clearly, his family had money. You can also see some of Rivera's work displayed in the many rooms. The exhibit descriptions are all in Spanish, They don't have English-speaking tour guides or offer a headset with English language."
"Con tan gran personaje es necesario conocerlo mas, además la casa esta muy acogedora, y se pueden apreciar algunos bosquejos del gran maestro."
"Una excelente colección de obras de Diego Rivera y la casa es bonita y puede una darse cuenta como vivia una familia de principios del siglo pasado."
"El acervo cultural con el que cuenta este museo es de primera, así como la orientación de todas las obras. El lugar se encuentra ubicado a unos pasos de la Alhóndiga de Granaditas."

"Every time I guide a city tour in Guanajuato, I take my group to this Museum. I love to let my tourists know about the early years of Diego as a child in the house. Dont miss the exhibition of some of the first art works by Diego Rivera as student in Europe."

Título de la opinión: "Te transporta a otro tiempo es fascinante"
Opinión: "Si pones atención el museo de Diego te transporta a otro tiempo de la era de Diego y Kahlo. Por entrar te cobran $30 MXN. Soy fan de Diego y disfrute muchisimo de el museo con todas las pinturas y datos de ellos, los cuartos donde Diegito aprendio caminar y correr, Fue muy impresionante para mi. Pero como todo arte la experiencia como la belleza esta en el quien lo contempla. A mi me fue facinante. 2 horas deben ser suficientes para cual quier visitante."

"Muy centrico y no lleva mucho tiempo. La casa en si no es la gran cosa, sobre todo porque Diego Rivera vivio allí hasta los 4 o 5 años, pero tiene una linda colección de obras de Diego Rivera que valen la pena."
"Interesante pero no pude entrar a todas las salas del museo por estar cerradas. Pregunté cuál era el motivo y sólo se me indicó que abrían más tarde."

"Es interesante la exhibición del museo, pero lo que más disfrute fue la excelente atención de la gente. La señora que da explicaciones acerca de los murales es una de las personas más atentas que nos encontramos en Guanajuato. ¡En realidad disfrute mucho su plática! :)"

Título de la opinión: "Terrificy if you are a Diego Rivera fan"
Opinión: "Small museum, very well done. Downstairs, a recreation of how rivera's famiky home could have been. Upstairs a small selection of rivera pieces, including some vey early pieces. Specially inteesting are the sketches of murals. There is a small auditorium whee a guide tells the atory of the house, and some oF the paintings. We were very lucky, one of the museum docents was at the library, and told my kid some awesome anecdotes of the house, and some of the paintings in the collection. I am not sur if she speaks english (the convesation was in spanish); but it was an awesome exoerience for the whole family, and when we went back and saw the collection again, we saw it in a completely different light."
"Como soy fanático de Diego Rivera, me gustó mucho todas las salas y me permitió disfrutar mucho de sus trabajos."

Título de la opinión: "Okay, but fun to imagine a time gone by"
Opinión: "It is really just his childhood home. Nothing too spectacular, but if you love his art it will be fascinating. Worth a visit. Along the same lines as Frida's house in D.F. In that it is more of a step into their day to day lives than a presentation of their art."

"La verdad no tenia muchas expectativas al visitar este museo, pero es una casa muy interesante, con muebles de la epoca de la niñez del artista, auditorio con un mural donde se explica el mismo, y obras originales de los distintos periodos del artista, muy buen museo, vale totalmente la pena."

"Me gustaron mucho los muebles de época, que la casa se conserva sin modificaciones y el pequeño auditorio cn fotos de Diego, peeeero me gustaría que le dieran más importancia y dedicación al museo, que se sienta más de Diego en el lugar, por que fuera de las fotos no nos dice nada más que lo que nos dirian en otro museo con muebles similares...."

"La verdad se requiere de un buen tiempo para disfrutar de todo lo que el museo, ofrece pues no solo el inmueble también los muebles, las pinturas, la historia la sala de proyección y por si fuera poco una exposición de arte moderno extra."

"El museo todo me encantó,las salas están muy bien,mucha información,el Señor guía es muy bueno pero,hace el recorrido demasiado largo pues se sale de tema a cada rato,ésto propicia que después de un tiempo me haya cansado."

"Me gustó mucho que todavía conserva su decoración original, la casa cuenta con muebles y objetos personales del artista y de su familia, también se exhiben100 obras originales importantes de su colección. visitenla les gustará conocer como vivió este ilustre pintor mexicano."

Título de la opinión: "Excellent example of how much Mexico esteems artists"
Opinión: "The house was terrific--great samples of his art--did not like that it was four stories high with no elevator or airconditioning."

"La casa de Diego Rivera es un museo con obra de Diego además de exposiciones fotograficas. La casa es sin duda muy bella. Pienso que deberían ser más exigentes con las exposiciones que ponen de exigir calidad porque la que me tocó cuando fui no tiene calidad."

"It's a little far fetched thinking that the bassinet is really what Diego Rivera slept in but it's well presented and the upstairs areas with his art in are fantastic to see the diversity of his work.
Worth a visit. You can also use the bathroom in there so you can say you sat on the loo of Diego!!!!"

Título de la opinión: "So Much More Than I Was Expecting!"
Opinión: "This is the museum the overrated Delores Olmedo Museum in Mexico City wishes it was. The house Diego Rivera was born in is modest but well-kept. The first floor is dedicated too the furnishings he was born into. Upstairs, however, is a treat I wasn't expecting: many rooms of his paintings, sketches, photographs ... Many of them from very early in his career and the influence of Paris and it's art scene at the turn of the 20th century is apparent. I loved every piece. His sketch of Hitler for a mural for Rockefeller is amazing."

Título de la opinión: "Interesting Display of Art in the Artist's Birthplace"
Opinión: "Sketches and paintings from Diego Rivera's early and later years are on display in this house in central Guanajuato where he was born and spent the first years of his life. The lower rooms are furnished in the style of the late 19th Century. The upper level rooms have Rivera's art work on display. A video of Rivera's life is shown in one room."

Título de la opinión: "En una pequeña casa convertida en un museo"
Opinión: "Un curso interesante de su obra y su vida. Nos gustó, incluso los niños."
"Ver la manera como vivió este artista me transporto a sus tiempos...y lo mas hermoso su obra."
"Según entiendo no vivió mucho tiempo en esa casa, sin embargo, en el último piso tienen obra de Diego donde se pueden ver los inicios de este gran artista, vale la pena por eso."
"Llegas y te reciben de mala gana como si te hicieran el favor de dejarte pasar."

"Muy buen museo, con obras ORIGINALES de Diego, su historia, su comienzo en el arte, sus experiencias y en la casa donde nacio, no dejen de visitarlo, ademas esta en camino a conocer la Alhóndiga y el mercado Hidalgo."

"This is in the childhood home of Diego Rivera and is outfitted with furniture that was not his or his family's but from that time period. I don't really understand posing the rooms as though they were filled with the furnishing that his family used. If you are a fan of his art work, then the upper floors are worth the visit."

"Refleja el amor que Diego tuvo a Mexico mediante la colección impresionante de figuritas prehispanicas, sus pininos como pintor cuando era niño mostrando su talento desde pequeño. Diego es grande entre los grnde Pintores en al historia de México."
"Esmerada atencion y recien remodelado, nos gusto toda la orientación que nos dieron asi como el mapa muy bien explicado."

"If Diego River is your cup of tea, then you should definitely check out his childhood home. There are some of his lesser works at the museum. There aren't many of his most famous works there, but still quite fun to see where he was born & some of his work up close & personal, most famous or not. My favorite part, personally, was the replica of his "Dream of a Sunday Afternoon in Alameda" the original of which is in Mexico City. There was information on who each of the people in the mural was or represented. If THAT interests you, be prepared to spend an extra hour there! "

"Me gusto mucho este museo ya que nos muestra toda la vida de Diego Rivera desde su infancia... Nos muestra sus principales obras y hay una area de cine donde puedes ver un documental de su vida. Además hay un espacio donde te hablan de sus murales... Es un lugar que no deben de dejar de visitar cuando estén en guanajuato ademas de que cobran $5 a los estudiantes."
"Worth going but not high on the priority list. Not much about him as an artist, his boyhood home. A little peek into the time period."
"It has a sense of being in his childghood home where he greww up,very enjoyable."
"Diego home is small but upper level galleries including rotating exhibits more than make up for it. Lots to see up there! (oh, and it's very 'no photos')"
"Es un excelente lugar para conocer como vivió el pintor Diego Rivera y sus obras. Me encantó."

Título de la opinión: "Limited display makes this mostly for those paying homage"
Opinión: "Somewhat overrated, the downstairs has some musty XIXth century furniture supposedly evoking what the home was like when Diego Rivera was born here. Upstairs are a handful of galleries, some with modern art on termporary loan, and some with early Diego Rivera or sketches for murals. Under the circumstances a pretty limited display...made somewhat amusing by the Easter altar in the upper landing which was definitely "off-message"."
"Aquí se puede encontrar bocetos de Diego incluyendo dos desnudos de Frida a lápiz que el mismo dibujó."

"Frida Kahlo  de la casa se encuentra en la Ciudad de México, pero el marido de Diego Rivera Guanajuato • nació. Nació y se crió en la casa se ha convertido en un museo. Video también proyectó por su vida junto con el trabajo. Pequeño pero satisfactorio, es un buen ambiente museo."
"Vale la pena disfrutar de la pintura y de la historia de este gran artísta mexicano Diego Rivera."

Título de la opinión: "Decent museum if you have extra time"
Opinión: "Don't visit expecting his famous works! The museum focuses on his childhood here and contains some sketches, etc. I knew his great pieces were not here, but I was expecting more substance from this museum."

"Great to see the childhood home of D. Rivera. Some of his early work is here, which helps to flesh him out as an artist, seeing his cubist work and portraits before his murals were fully developed. Also, great house: must be great to be a wealthy communist!"
"Who knew there were so many Rivera paintings and drawings in Guanajuato?!? Expecting just to see Rivera's birthplace, we were delighted with his art, especially the early and cubist works."
"This was the best display of Rivera's work. Sadly, I could not take pictures inside."
"Es cierto que es un personaje que forma parte, de alguna manera de nuestra hisrtoria, pero nada mas."

"This house doubles as history spot and art collection. The base floor recreates the home Rivera knew as a boy, with pictures and portraits from the family. The upper floors (which vary in how many are open) contain Rivera's work, which span many years and forms. After seeing grand murals everywhere, to see small objects and be able to look at them at leisure and in detail was great. Here you can see his imitation of Picasso and Cezanne and Braques and other French notables but always in his own style. There are posters, sketches, watercolors, prints, and drawings. In other words, you have all the advantages of a museum without the crowds. Bags must be checked and photography is off limits. If steps are a challenge, this will be a challenge. Did not see an elevator. "

"This small but interesting museum has a nice collection of Diego Rivera's work- It was his family home, and is an important part of any Diego-Frida tour- with the mural in the National Palace and the Casa Azul both in Mexico City the highlights."
"This collection surprised me with the incredible variety of subjects and artistic styles he mastered. Definitely worth seeing."
"Shows the many styles of much beloved Mexican artist! Freda's husband-perhaps you saw the movie Frida?"
"Deberían ampliar un poco más los horarios ya que en puente o día de asueto no abren."
"This museum definitely lived up to our expecations. It was so interesting to see the wide range of talents Diego had as an artist. I believe it was only $20 pesos to get in. Great value!"
"Lots of artwork to see and also it's kind of neat to see Diego's home and furniture from so long ago! It's only 20 pesos to check it out too!"
"Un lugar no tan obligado, lleno de nostalgia. No lo recomiendo mucho."

"If you are a fan of Diego and/or Frida, you should stop here. The only downer was that they don't let you take photos of the pictures. We are art fans and visited Figures last year to see the Dali museum. My wife took many pictures there but she was rebuked by the people at Diego"s home."
"Debemos cuidarlo y fomentarlo... No es posible que solo paguemos $20 pesos por algo que vale mucho más... Por lo menos al extranjero deberían cobrarle 5 ó 10 usd."
"Interesting displays of Rivera's and some of his contemporaries work. The city is clearly proud of their native son. Well worth an hour's visit."

"So much work you probably had no idea Rivera created! Until I visited this museum/home, I didn't know he had experimented with so many different styles, nor did I realize how knowledgeable he was of the ancient indigenous artistic techniques. Great temporary exhibits of important Mexican artists on the third or fourth floor--likely someone you should know about but don't! Come for the art, not the house itself. "
"Bonito y pequeño museo con originales del artista, cuyo lugar de nacimiento.  Con poca gente .... ver Alhondigada y Mercado."

Título de la opinión: "Discover other than huge murals by Diego"
Opinión: "It was very interesting to see smaller drawings by Diego Rivera in many different styles than the murals he became famous for."

"The house is only moderately interesting. What's intriguing are the early works of Rivera, a reproduction of a mural with a character key and some Asian-influenced watercolors. This is not an academic survey of the painter's work but rather shows how his work evolved."
"If nothing else, it's worth visiting just to see the building/house itself. beautifully restored and has a decent collection of Rivera stuff. also temporary exhibits."

Título de la opinión: "Only one block off the main street"
Opinión: "How can you not go if you're in Guanajuato? A quintessential home for this village. The home for the most part looks original. Maybe Diego and his brother played on the heavenly worn wood and stone floor. A maze of rooms off the center stairwell. The second and third floors display the work of Rivera. All owned by the same collector. Sometimes there are exhibits of others displayed in the annex. Good deal and... you can check it off you things to see list:) On the same street as/and between the University and the Alhondiga De Granaditas."
"Small museum in the house that Rivera lived in when he was small. Showed various periods of Diego Rivera."
"Very reasonable admission fee. We enjoyed seeing the house and furniture as well as various styles of paintings that Diego Rivera did over many years. Plan about an hour for the visit."

"This was our 3rd visit to Guanajuato, & luckily we saw here on Tripadvisor the postings about the Diego Rivera Museum! It was amazing to see a work he did at 11 years of age! This 3 level museum was his home from birth to 6, when his family moved to Mexico City, but the home remained in the family & was donated as a museum about 40 years ago. The first floor shows how they lived 100 years ago. Art loves MUST see this museum, which contains more of his works than any other museum. He is famous for his huge murals but these paintings & drawings are incredible."

"I liked the casa rivera and thought it was a nice little museum. I found the paintings and sketches interesting and the chronological way they were presented let the viewer see how Diego's art progressed. If you're only familiar with his great murals you'll be surprised at the diffeent styles he experimented with in his youth. For only $2.00 it's a wonderful way to learn about one of Mexico's greatest artists. The gift shop is ok and actually features more prints by Fridda Kahlo than Diego! Don't miss it!"

Título de la opinión: "It's worth the time and the few pesos for admission"
Opinión: "Yes, it is the childhood home of well known artist Diego Rivera. The house is old and fairly large and interesting by itself. In many of the rooms drawings and paintings by the artist are on display. A couple of rooms had other exhibits too. You can certainly spend half an hour here unless you are a serious fan of Rivera's which would mean you would want to spend more time including some in the small museum shop. To get to the museum go up at least the hill a full block from the main street that runs through town. It is also very near the Alhondiga musuem."

"Es un gran museo, dado que Diego Rivera vivio ahi. En el museo (casa) se encuentran muchos de los objetos personales de Diego y varias de sus obras. El museo consta de 3 pisos y es un buen lugar para visitar y admirar el arte de este fabuloso artista."

"With only average expections on our part, the Diego Rivera museum turned out to be a delightful experience. The combination of the preservation of Rivera's upper class home near the center of Guanajuato along with a good collection of his work is worth a visit. In addition, at the time of our trip, the works of two contemporary and provocative Mexican artists who were also featured were every bit as fascinating as those of Rivera. The museum is low-key, uncrowded and quite interesting."
